Utöver produktägarrollen så kommer du också att vara drivande och aktiv i våra designforum som är viktiga för att skapa enhetlighet i vår visuella kommunikation, oavsett kanal. Tillsammans genomför ni design- och lösningsarbete för att skapa nytta för kund och användare.


Mina sidor är likt designsystemet en viktig del i att knyta ihop den digitala användarresan. Som en prioriterad kanal för kundens samlade kontakter och ärenden inom Lantmäteriets olika verksamheter är samverkan med andra produktägare och interna intressenter en viktig del av förvaltnings- och utvecklingsarbetet för att hämta och visa relevanta delmängder av information från våra system, och länka vidare till specifika e-tjänster. Då det digitala landskapet förändras över tid gäller det också att bevaka förändrade förutsättningar och nya möjligheter i vår strävan att skapa ytterligare värde för målgruppen och Lantmäteriets verksamhet genom vidare utveckling av Mina sidor.


Placeringsort är Gävle eller Stockholm med behov av regelbunden närvaro på vårt Gävlekontor.


**Din profil**
--------------


Vi söker dig som inom beskrivet arbetsområde har relevant universitets- eller högskoleutbildning alternativt motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade på annat sätt som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdiga. Du har minst 3 års erfarenhet av produktägarskap eller liknande roll med ansvar för digitala produkter/tjänster. Du har även god kompetens och praktisk erfarenhet av arbete med webbtillgänglighet och webbdesign. För tjänsten krävs även att du har en flerårig praktisk erfarenhet av agila och användardrivna arbetssätt samt en mycket god kompetens och praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med något designverktyg t.ex. Figma.


Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av arbete med designsystem. Även kompetens inom arbete med mät och analys i digitala kanaler är meriterande. Erfarenhet av anställning i offentlig sektor ses också som meriterande.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som har en god kommunikations - och samarbetsförmåga, tycker om att jobba i team, men är även van att arbeta och driva initiativ självständigt. Du har lätt för att skapa nya och goda relationer och är socialt aktiv. Du har en analytisk förmåga och ett lösningsorienterat och strukturerat arbetssätt som leder fram till effektiva lösningar med hög användbarhet.


Tjänsten hos oss innebär placering i säkerhetsklass. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan anställning.


**Övrig information**
---------------------


På Lantmäteriet arbetar vi med att säkra ägandet av fastigheter och att tillgängliggöra geodata till samhället och vi är myndigheten som tar ledning i digitaliseringen av samhällsbyggnadsprocessen. Lantmäteriet är i ständig utveckling och det är också alla vi som jobbar här, våra medarbetare är vår viktigaste resurs för att lyckas med vårt uppdrag. I medarbetarskapet ingår att vi agerar utifrån den statliga värdegrunden och våra värdeord: service, öppenhet och handlingskraft.


Som medarbetare på Lantmäteriet ska du kunna förena arbete med fritid och ha en bra balans i livet. När verksamheten tillåter har du bland annat möjlighet att utföra dina arbetsuppgifter till stor del på annan plats än kontoret. Läs mer om vårt erbjudande på lm.se/jobbahososs


För att skicka in din ansökan, klicka på länken i annonsen. Frågor om hur du ansöker och lägger in ditt CV ställer du direkt till Visma Recruit 0771- 693 693.


Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om rekryterings- och annonshjälp.


Urval sker löpande under ansökningstiden.


I denna rekrytering tillämpas sex månaders provanställning.


**Om Lantmäteriet**
-------------------


Lantmäteriet är den myndighet som kartlägger Sverige. Till våra uppgifter hör också att registrera och säkra ägandet av alla fastigheter samt hantera deras gränser. Nu söker vi dig som har ett starkt samhällsengagemang.


Det myndighetsgemensamma verksamhetsområdet består av stödjande och styrande enheter som bistår Lantmäteriets övriga verksamhetsområden. Här är du med och ser till att vardagen fungerar! Hos oss får du utvecklas i en viktig samhällsfunktion där din kompetens och ditt engagemang är vår främsta resurs.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Software Engineer


Swedium Global Services is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Job Name: Software Engineer\_Front End


Location: Onsite in Sweden


As a Senior Front-end Developer within the UI Framework team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the direction and technical implementation of our user interface framework. You will work with a small team of talented Front-End Developers, collaborating closely with the UI Platform team, Designers, Product Managers, and other stakeholders to create robust, scalable, and reusable UI components and patterns. Your expertise in front-end development, particularly in React.js, React Native, Material-UI (MUI), and theming, will drive the evolution of our Design System and UI framework, ensuring consistency, performance, and maintainability across our web and react native applications.  

  

**Responsibilities:**  

\* Technical Leadership: Provide technical guidance and mentorship to a team of Front-End Developers, fostering a culture of excellence, collaboration, and innovation. Lead by example through hands-on development and code reviews.  

\* Design System Development: Drive the development and evolution of our Design System, including the design, implementation, and maintenance of reusable components, layouts, and theming solutions. Ensure alignment with industry best practices and emerging trends.  

\* Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including UX/UI Designers, Product Managers, and Back-end Developers, to understand requirements, define technical solutions, and ensure seamless integration with backend systems.  

\* Architectural Design: Contribute to the architectural design and technical roadmap of our front-end applications, advocating for scalable and maintainable solutions. Evaluate new technologies and frameworks to improve development efficiency and user experience.  

\* Quality Assurance: Establish and enforce coding standards, best practices, and testing strategies to ensure high-quality and performant code. Conduct code reviews, automated testing, and performance optimization to maintain a high level of reliability and user satisfaction.  

\* Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Create and maintain technical documentation, guidelines, and patterns for the UI framework. Facilitate knowledge-sharing sessions and workshops to onboard new team members and promote continuous learning.  

  

**Your profile:**  

Most important of all is your personality and desire to drive a concept and refinement work supporting our goals. We believe that you have a university degree in a relevant field and several years of experience in complex front-end development. You will encounter challenges and complexities daily. The ability to approach problems analytically, break them down into manageable components, and devise creative solutions is crucial.  

  

Experience in the automotive industry is considered beneficial, as well as experience within a field close to or within front-end development frameworks and tools. We think you have great knowledge and ability to create and present concepts and new ideas, both for technical specialists and people without technical knowledge.


  
Job Overview


* Location : Gothenburg, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : Frontend, UI

title: Senior UX Designer – Konsultuppdrag i Stockholm
description:
Start: ASAP  

Slut: 28 februari 2026 (med möjlighet till förlängning och utökning av uppdraget)  

Omfattning: **100% första månaden, därefter 50%**  

Plats: Office first i Stockholm, med viss flexibilitet för fokusarbete


Arbetsuppgifter
  

Kartlägga behov och arbetsprocesser hos centrala och regionala användare  

Ta fram wireframes, flöden och interaktiva prototyper i Figma  

Samverka nära med produktägare, utvecklare och verksamheten för att möta affärsbehoven  

Delta i användartester och iterera design baserat på insikter  

Dokumentera lösningar för smidig handover till utveckling  

Säkerställa intuitiva, samarbetsfrämjande och skalbara lösningar


Kravprofil
  

Minst 3–5 års erfarenhet som UX-designer  

Van att arbeta med digitala gränssnitt och interna processlösningar  

Förmåga att förstå komplexa behov från flera intressenter och skapa användarvänliga lösningar  

Erfarenhet av iterativt och tvärfunktionellt arbetssätt


Meriterande
  

Erfarenhet av kampanjhantering, marknadsföring eller planeringssystem  

Tidigare arbete med samordnings- och effektiviseringslösningar i stora organisationer  

Design för användargrupper spridda över olika orter och regioner  

Erfarenhet av Service Design

  

Verktyg & metoder
  

Figma  

UX-metodik: användarresor, personas, flöden, prototyper, användartester  

Grundläggande förståelse för tillgänglighet och designsystem

  

Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.


Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: Product Designer
description:
### **About InvestEngine**


We’re a London-based fintech on a mission to make ETF investing simple, smart, and accessible. Over 100,000 clients have trusted us with over £1.5 billion in assets — and we’re just getting started. We’ve been featured by Forbes, MoneyWeek, and Finder, and we’re growing fast with big ambitions to triple AUM in the next year.

### **About the Role**


We’re looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our Product Design team and craft outstanding client interfaces across mobile, web, and browser platforms. You’ll work on complex financial product interactions — from onboarding to portfolio management — ensuring they’re both intuitive and visually engaging.


This is a high-impact, standalone role in a new position within the team. You’ll own your projects end-to-end, collaborate closely with product, engineering, and business stakeholders, and have a direct influence on how our customers experience investing. We also expect you to work collaboratively in a team with other designers.

### **What You’ll Do**

* Design complex financial product interfaces for mobile app, as well as for mobile and desktop web browser.
* Create and iterate on user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and final designs.
* Conduct user interviews and usability testing to validate design decisions.
* Translate research insights and metrics into clear design improvements.
* Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and other designers throughout the process.
* Communicate and defend design decisions with strong rationale.  

Ensure timely delivery of designs in line with sprint commitments.

### **What We’re Looking For**

* 5+ years of UI/UX design experience with complex product interfaces.
* Experience working with Figma and modern design systems.
* Experience conducting user research and usability testing.
* Ability to make data-informed design decisions.
* Strong English (B2+) to confidently communicate with native-speaking business team members.

### **Nice to Have**

* Background in fintech or other regulated industries.
* Experience with data-heavy or highly interactive interfaces.
* Track record designing for both consumer and professional audiences.
* Experience in creating 3D images (Cinema 4D preferred).
  

### **How We Work**


We’re a lean, fast-moving team that values clarity, initiative, and ownership. Designers are embedded in product teams from day one, shaping solutions alongside engineers and product managers — never as an afterthought.

### **What We Offer**

* **Impact from day one**  

You’ll shape how thousands of people interact with our product. From portfolio views to trading flows — your work will make a real difference.
* **Real contribution and growth**  

We’re building something meaningful, and you’ll have the opportunity to grow with it. Your designs will be core to delivering value to customers.
* **Supportive team of experts**  

Work alongside experienced, collaborative teammates with deep fintech expertise.
* **Flexible setup**  

Fully remote. Flexible schedule.

title: Test Specialist
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Work closely together with business analysts and solution architects to fully understand the requirements and solution to be tested
* Work closely with manual testers to capture test payloads for new functionality and request what needs to be tested
* Secure testability of the backlog/user stories in the backlog grooming process
* Be part of the agile team with joint responsibility to deliver quality secured features to production
* Continue to develop our regression test tool by adding new features
* Add new tests in the regression test tool for new functionality
* Adapt and configure existing tests to test only what is necessary (find a good balance)
* Executing regression on demand and report defects
* Monitoring and making sure the regression test reports are kept "green" without defects

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Believes in test-driven development and takes the responsibility of securing test quality in the team
* Self-driven to improve and strives for good quality of team deliverables
* Experience in agile test process and test automation
* Experience in setting up automated tests with standard and home built tools
* Risk-driven and able to define the right level of needed test coverage
* Good at troubleshooting
* Experience in containerized execution models (kubernetes)
* Experience in testing of applications with event driven patterns
* Experience of working in DevOps teams, knowledgeable within DevOps philosophy
* Coding and scripting experience (the application is built in Kotlin, scripting is typically in Python)
* Bonus to have experience in setting up and executing UX testing tools (web application is built in Flutter/Dart)

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 03-09-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled UX/UI Designer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Design high-quality and user-friendly interfaces for web and mobile. Examples: UniFi Network app, UniFi Protect app, UniFi Design System, ui.com, store.ui.com, design.ui.com and more
* Embrace a design-first approach, pushing the boundaries of design by working on new and innovative ideas
* Co-work with key stakeholders including leadership, strategists, developers (FE/FS) and other designers
* Navigate an agile work environment, iterating quickly yet maintaining high quality
* Actively participate in mulitple projects across the company and voice your ideas on design improvements


**Requirements**
* Expert level UX and UI design skills
* Minimum five (5) years of experience designing interfaces for web and mobile
* Highly proficient in Figma
* Strong interest in working hands-on with design, considering both user experience and UIs
* You take full ownership of your tasks and responsibilites
* Genuine passion for great UX
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Knowledge about networking & wireless technologies
* Experience with Adobe After Effects or any other animation tool for interactions
* Skilled in Cinema 4D or Blender


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests


***Please note that a background check will be conducted in the final stage of the recruitment process***

title: Visual Marketing Designer
description:
Fjällräven is looking for a Visual Marketing Designer who can bring our brand to life through thoughtful, creative, and impactful design. In this role, you’ll create everything from campaign visuals to retail materials, helping us connect with people in meaningful ways. If you love turning ideas into engaging visuals, and are ready to take the next step in career – we can’t wait to hear from you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Visual Marketing Designer, you will be part of our Global Creative Design & Studio team, working closely with Global Visual Desigers and the wider Creative Design & Studio team. You will create campaign visuals and retail marketing materials for both digital and physical channels — from social media and email to in-store signage. Your work will help ensure that Fjällräven is represented with consistency, creativity and clarity across all touchpoints.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Design and produce a wide range of campaign and retail marketing materials: Catalogues (Worktool), print, email, paid ads, social media content, in-store materials, hangtags, signage and seasonal assets.
* Collaborate with internal and external creatives — copywriters, motion designers, and content creators — to deliver compelling, user-centric brand experiences.
* Contribute to seasonal updates and campaign design for both Fjällräven stores and wholesale retail spaces.
* Create assets for retail touchpoints, including catalogues, point of sale materials, window displays, digital signage, and more.
* Ensure consistency of brand guidelines, storytelling and user experience across all channels.
* Stay up to date on industry trends in retail marketing, content strategy, and brand design to continuously push our creative forward.


**Who You Are**
* Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design (or equivalent experience).
* At least 5 years of experience as a Visual Designer, ideally with agency and/or in-house backgrounds.
* Experience working on large, cross-channel brand initiatives — ideally in outdoor, lifestyle, or sport industries.
* Excellent English skills and have a strong portfolio showcasing retail marketing design capabilities.
* Skilled in Adobe Creative Suite and other digital design tools such as Figma.
* Strong understanding for Design and Visual Merchandising.
* Experience in photo editing, and video editing skills being nice-to-have
* Highly collaborative, with the ability to turn creative ideas into impactful executions.


**How To Apply**
 At Fjällräven, design is more than visuals — it’s how people experience our brand in everyday life. If this sounds like the kind of work you would like to be part of, we would love to hear from you. Please send us your CV (in English) through our application portal.
   

  

 This is a full-time consulting position for one year, based at our office in Solna. Our office policy allows for one flexible work-from-home day per week; on the remaining days we work from the office.
   

  

 In 1960,
 *Åke Nordin* 
 founded
 *Fjällräven* 
 in his basement in the town of
 *Örnsköldsvik* 
 in northern
 *Sweden.* 
 Today the company’s timeless, functional and durable outdoor equipment enjoys a global presence and can be found in over 70 countries.
   

  

 Fjällräven’s product range comprises outdoor clothing and accessories for men and women as well as backpacks, tents and sleeping bags. As a company, Fjällräven makes every effort to act responsibly towards people, wildlife and the environment and to encourage people to take an interest in outdoor life.
   

  

 The company is the initiator of two popular outdoor events,
 *Fjällräven Classic* 
 and
 *Fjällräven Polar* 
 , which attract thousands of participants every year. Fjällräven is part of
 *Fenix Outdoor AB* 
 .

title: SEO Specialist
description:
📍Stockholm
   

  

 📆 As soon as possible
   

  

 👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week
   

  

 📚 Our Recruitment Process
   

  

 At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.
   

  

 Are you curious to learn more about us? Read more about us here. For insights into what life is like at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.
   

  

*We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.*
**What You Will Be Doing**
* Independently execute and optimise SEO tactics, ensuring they are aligned with the set strategic direction.
* Handle day-to-day operational tasks, including analysis, optimisation, and reporting, to ensure high-quality execution and optimal organic performance in standard search and search generative experiences.
* Extract and analyse data to uncover trends and insights that can guide tactical decisions and continuous improvement efforts.
* Conduct in-depth SEO analysis and audits to identify opportunities for improving brand strength and performance metrics.
* Implement testing initiatives, analyse results, and make optimisation recommendations to improve organic performance.
* Provide clients with concise, actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights, guiding strategic decisions.
* Collaborate closely with other Solution Groups to action learnings into the overall success of client experience and delivery.
* Proactively contribute to the overall growth of the SEO business.


**What We Are Looking For**
* Solid understanding of the digital marketing ecosystem, with the ability to operationally navigate all three pillars of SEO (Technical, Content & Authority) as well as AI generated search.
* Comprehensive hands-on experience and knowledge in using SEO tools & platforms (e.g. Ahrefs, SEMrush, Screaming Frog, or similar) to tailor SEO strategies for brand and performance objectives.
* Technical acumen to identify, mitigate and resolve SEO-related issues, ensuring smooth execution of SEO activities.
* Strong capability to analyse performance data, identify trends, and derive actionable insights to enhance SEO efforts.
* Capability to design and implement roadmaps to achieve client goals and correlated targets, as well as showcase untapped opportunities within SEO and CRO.
* Ability to develop hypotheses and conduct tests to inform continuous improvement practices.
* Effective communication skills for engaging with clients on operational aspects and contributing to strategic conversations.
* Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g. LookerStudio) and ability to present insights in an engaging and understandable manner.
* In addition to specialisation in SEO, be comfortable with CRO & UX fundamentals and how these work together to impact total website performance.


**What We Offer**
*You can read our full offering in our* 
*handbook.*
* An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
* A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
* Transparent salary setting, you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an L2 role within the Media, Client & SEO/CRO column. Check it out!
* 30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
* A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis and our internal inclusion score is 4.3 out of 5.


**We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.**

title: Business Analyst
description:

 (Hybrid – 3 days onsite and 2 days remote)

 Contract Duration:

* Currently should live in

 with a valid Citizenship/Work permit to work in
 **Sweden** 
 (We are not providing sponsorship)

 speaker

 :
 


* Digital Lending consists of several cross-functional agile teams that design, build and maintain Lending products in digital customer channels (internet bank, mobile bank) for bank customers in Sweden
* Digital Lending will augment the current teams with 8 new FTCs in different roles. To have the right balance between different roles and competencies we need 2 Business Analysts

* Lead the work of gathering requirements from the business and other stakeholders.

 Excellent communication skills and being fluent both in

title: Design Manager
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

 We’re looking for a passionate and strategic Design Manager to lead design across our web and print-based AAC (Augmentative and Alternative Communication) products. In this role, you’ll guide a multidisciplinary team of product and graphic designers, collaborating closely with product, engineering, research, and AAC experts. Your leadership will shape how individuals with complex communication needs interact with tactile and digital tools—driven by empathy, accessibility, and inclusive design.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead and inspire a team of product and graphic designers, fostering growth, collaboration, and craft excellence.
* Champion user-centered and inclusive design practices across both print-based products (e.g., symbol books, communication boards) and digital platforms.
* Partner with product and engineering leadership to define and execute the design vision and strategy.
* Act as a bridge between physical and digital design thinking, ensuring a cohesive experience across products.
* Facilitate team rituals, design reviews, and cross-functional critiques that elevate quality and creativity.
* Advocate for accessibility and user research, ensuring our tools serve people with communication challenges, caregivers, and educators.
* Support hiring, onboarding, and team health initiatives to build a diverse and resilient design culture.
* Own and improve design processes, documentation, and workflows to help the team scale and deliver impact efficiently. Perform various other duties as assigned.


**Minimum Qualifications**
* 6+ years of experience in product, UX, or graphic design, with a strong portfolio spanning both digital tools and tactile/print-based design.
* 2+ years of experience managing designers, with a proven track record of growing individuals and teams.
* Ability to lead through ambiguity, navigate complex requirements, and balance the needs of diverse users and stakeholders.
* Familiarity or experience in AAC, assistive technology, education, or healthcare spaces.


 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Visual and Motion Designer
description:
Established in 2004,
 **OLIVER** 
 is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
   

  

 As a part of
 **The Brandtech Group** 
 , we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
 **AI solutions** 
 enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
   

  

**Visual and Motion Designer**
 Type: permanent
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Sweden (hybrid)
   

  

**Portfolio Is Required**
**About the role:**
 Working in partnership with our client, a renowned global leader in the drinks and beverages industry to recruit a talented Visual and Motion Designer. This role involves taking digital, print, and social content projects from concept to completion.
   

  

 You'll infuse fresh ideas, spark consumer interest through compelling creativity, and adhere to brand guidelines, managing projects within time and budget constraints. Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary dynamic team of 15 creative professionals, including Art Directors, designers, copywriters, project managers, UX designers, developers, and product managers, to shape and elevate our brand's visual identity. Reporting directly to the Creative Director, you'll be a key player in driving design excellence and innovation.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Concept, idea development and visual design.
* Graphic design development including artwork, mock-ups, presentations, motion design/graphics.
* Social Media asset production.
* Monitor industry trends and research developments in branding and marketing.
* Produce designs/ideas to the client's brief and exacting standards from start to completion.
* Direct, oversee and execute production of content and concepts for digital platforms.
* Ensure all content is highest quality and relevant for multiple markets.
* Direct development of post imagery and copy, including guiding team members.
* Work proactively to push brands toward new creative expressions.
* Ensure all concepts follow responsible communication guidelines.
* Develop effective working relationships with colleagues and clients.


**What You Need To Be Great In This Role** 
  

  

* Motion Design and Animation:
+ Strong skills in 2D motion design and animation.
+ Keen eye for timing, rhythm, and visual storytelling.
+ Proficiency in After Effects and Premiere.
+ Ability to storyboard animation concepts.
+ Experience creating engaging motion graphics for various platforms.

* Video Editing:
+ Proficient in editing video content for multiple platforms.
+ Skill in ensuring narrative flow and brand consistency.
+ Up-to-date knowledge of current editing trends, techniques, and emerging tools.
+ Experience in post-production and FX.
+ Ability to adapt content for different digital formats and channels.

* Design:
+ Solid foundation in graphic design, including typography, layout, and composition.
+ Ability to support and interpret art direction across motion and static assets.
+ Comfortable contributing to visual concept development.
+ Strong collaboration skills with senior creatives.
+ Experience creating cohesive design systems across multiple touchpoints.

* Excellent client engagement skills with the ability to proactively organise and influence clients and build strong and effective working relationships
* An innate creative flair, interested in art direction and in developing concepting skills
* Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite including Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign.
* Strong typography, layout and technical skills with excellent attention to detail
* An understanding how to work across online banners (static and animated), social media posts (primarily Instagram and Facebook), web design, UI design, HTML email and storytelling
* An understanding of responsive design across all digital platforms
* An understanding of UX and latest Social and Digital technology trends
* Motion and video skills using After Effects, Premiere and Storyboarding Animation concepts
* Working on print-based collateral with great knowledge of branding
* The ability to talk through your ideas confidently with the team and clients
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office and a keen interest in emerging technologies such as AI enhance project deliveries.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks and beverages sectors preferred.
* Fluency in Swedish and English


 Req ID: 13239
   

  

**Our Values Shape Everything We Do**
 Be
 **Ambitious** 
 to succeed
   

  

 Be
 **Imaginative** 
 to push the boundaries of what’s possible
   

  

 Be
 **Inspirational** 
 to do groundbreaking work
   

  

 Be
 **always learning and listening** 
 to understand
   

  

 Be
 **Results-focused** 
 to exceed expectations
   

  

 Be
 **actively pro-inclusive and anti-racist** 
 across our community, clients and creations
   

  

*OLIVER,* 
*a part of the Brandtech Group, is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees are encouraged to reach their full potential, and individual differences are valued and respected. All applicants shall be considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, neurodivergence, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by local laws.*
*OLIVER has set ambitious environmental goals around sustainability, with science-based emissions reduction targets. Collectively, we work towards our mission, embedding sustainability into every department and through every stage of the project lifecycle.*

* Excellent client engagement skills with the ability to proactively organise and influence clients and build strong and effective working relationships

title: Product Manager
description:
Over the past eight years we have provided smart tools that help put financial power back in the hands of the people – where we believe it belongs. Everything we do is based on one vision: to improve the financial health of our users - one credit at the time.
   

  

 So far, we’ve helped millions of users by refinancing expensive consumer loans. But we aim higher; new markets, new products and new ways of improving financial lives in an innovative way. As a Product Manager you will be responsible for our core offering joining a diverse scaleup environment with co-workers who are motivated, adaptable and committed to creating fantastic (we mean amazing) products.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 We believe that everyone should get the interest rate they deserve, meaning that assisting our users with debt management will always be at the core of what we do. In this role you will take responsibility for our core product (refinancing) while expanding the product portfolio by identifying and building new fintech solutions that people actually need. Naturally you will lead a talented team of engineers, designers and other expertise assisting you in achieving our mission. As if that wasn't enough your responsibilities will cover:
   

  

**Product Strategy And Vision**
* Define product goals, target customers, primary features, and use cases.
* Determine success metrics and incorporate user input into the product life cycle.
* Own and drive a positive revenue outcome through connecting product performance to the business’s top-level goals.
* Leverage your financial expertise to understand market trends, identify opportunities, and navigate regulations.


**Execution**
* Drive alignment and execution by collaborating with engineering, advocating for resources, and clearing obstacles to keep the roadmap on track.
* Lead with focus and efficiency, juggling multiple priorities, and guiding your team toward impactful delivery.
* Leverage data analytics to improve the product and design A/B tests.


**Communication And Coordination**
* Organize and communicate team progress, status and obstacles.
* Convey the rationale behind the product roadmap and trade-offs to the entire organization.


**Who You Are**
 In order to be successful in this role you will need to be able to make the complex understandable. Your role will deal with intricate aspects of our product portfolio and creating understanding across functions and domains is paramount in order to achieve a great result. We believe that you will need at least three years of experience as a PM, but we all know that one year of experience is not the same as another. It all depends on what you have done during your career. While experience from Fintech is not a requirement, it will help you greatly in this role and if you have worked on Credit products before, let's just say we will fast track your application out of pure excitement.
   

  

 Moreover we would like to see evidence of the following in your background:
   

  

* 3 years of experience from leading a product team of designers and engineers in a product technology environment.
* Education or experience that has a strong business, commercial and technology focus with a track record showcasing your impact in previous roles.
* Knowledge of product methodologies, user research and product road-mapping.
* Experience in digital products: mobile and web applications and working in an international context.
* A strong business and commercial understanding and a real interest in what drives customer engagement. This enables you to push design boundaries. If that feels like a “buzzword sentence” it's because it is, but we have a feeling you know what we mean.


 In short we are looking for a pragmatic product generalist with a mix of business development and doer mentality. If you are still reading this we hope that sounds like a good fit? So let's get to the good stuff…
   

  

**We offer you** 
 the chance to be part of something truly amazing. We aspire for a level of ambition that matches the scale of our mission. If you're ready to co-lead this transformation, to inspire and elevate our teams to new heights, we want to hear from you. If you have high grit, an unwavering sense of urgency, and an unyielding commitment to excellence, we want you to be the driving force behind reshaping the financial world. This isn't just a job; it's a mission.
   

  

 We promise that you will be challenged, pushed to develop your skill set and get the opportunity to work alongside amazing and smart colleagues. At Anyfin, we hire great people and create the conditions for them to have real autonomy and impact, especially in product management. While we've had a good run so far it is what lies ahead that excites everyone that works here, and we are just getting started. Then there is the compensation package, centrally located cozy office, extra time off on your birthday and a bunch of other benefits as well. But we will get to all that in due time.
   

  

 For now begin your journey with us by clicking "Apply" below.
   

  

 We cannot wait to meet you!
   

  

 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Motion Designer
description:
Established in 2004,
 **OLIVER** 
 is the world’s first and only specialist in designing, building, and running bespoke in-house agencies and marketing ecosystems for brands. We partner with over 300 clients in 40+ countries and counting. Our unique model drives creativity and efficiency, allowing us to deliver tailored solutions that resonate deeply with audiences.
   

  

 As a part of
 **The Brandtech Group** 
 , we're at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to revolutionise how we create and deliver work. Our
 **AI solutions** 
 enhance efficiency, spark creativity, and drive insightful decision-making, empowering our teams to produce innovative and impactful results.
   

  

**Motion Designer (6-month FTC with view to extend)**
 Location: Stockholm, Sweden (hybrid)
   

  

**Portfolio Is Required**
**About the role:**
 Are you passionate about motion design, and showcasing your creative and technical talents? We invite you to join our team as a skilled Motion Designer, where your expertise in creating animations, textures, high-quality 3D models, will bring innovative projects to life. Collaborating with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals, you will help redefine what's possible in motion design and 3D artistry while ensuring our projects meet the highest standards of quality and creativity.
   

  

 As a Motion Graphics Designer, you will support the team in executing high-quality design projects, motion graphics, and visual effects for various brands. This role combines hands-on design work with digital and visual design tasks, focusing on both 2D and occasionally 3D animation projects. Your ability to work in a fast-paced environment, coupled with your commitment to innovation and attention to detail, will drive the success of our projects.
   

  

 Reporting directly to the Creative Director the Motion Designer works alongside a multi-disciplinary dynamic team of creative professionals.
   

  

**What you will be doing:** 
  

  

* Motion Graphics & Visual Effects:
+ Support the design and production of motion graphics, animations, and visual effects for advertisements, product videos, and promotional content
+ Assist in editing and refining animations for fluidity and consistency across various media
+ Create digital assets for social media platforms
+ If/When needed, support with graphic design/final art to ensure project deliveries

* Digital & Visual Design:
+ Contribute to concept development, visual design, and graphic design for various projects
+ Assist in developing post imagery and copy, ensuring relevance for multiple markets
+ Support the creation of layout and design for guidelines, toolkits, and strategic documents
+ Participate in film editing, post-production, and creation of digital video assets

* 3D Design & Animation
+ Assist in creating detailed 3D models, textures, lighting, and rendering for products, environments, and characters.
+ Contribute to the development of high-quality, photorealistic renders and animations.
+ Help optimize 3D assets for performance across different platforms and devices.

* Collaboration and Communication:
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project goals, target audience, and creative direction.
+ Communicate effectively with stakeholders to present ideas, progress updates, and final deliverables.
+ Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute innovative ideas to enhance the overall design process.

* Technical Expertise:
+ Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in 3D/2D design and related technologies.
+ Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to 3D design & motion graphics software and workflows.
+ Mentor and train junior team members, sharing knowledge and best practices.

* Create detailed motion graphics, animations, and visual effects for various projects, including advertisements, product videos, and promotional content.
* Edit and refine animations to ensure flow.
* Develop high-quality, photorealistic renders and animations that meet project specifications and deadlines.
* Ensure all 3D assets are optimized for performance and compatibility across different platforms and devices.
* Create detailed 3D models, textures, lighting, and rendering for various projects, including products, environments, and characters.


**What you need to be great in this role:**
* 5-7 years of relevant experience
* Show an innate creative flair with exemplary art direction and concepting skills, bursting with ideas that span across multiple platforms. Exhibit a love for exceptional design, motion graphics, and storytelling.
* Possess outstanding modelling, lighting, compositing, and animation skills. Be proficient in the Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign, and utilize tools like Substance Designer to craft both organic and inorganic textures and materials.
* Maintain exceptional attention to detail, ensuring no typos or pixelation, and demonstrate a strong grasp of typography, layout, and technical skills that accentuate your craftsmanship.
* Be curious, creative, and ambitious, using your understanding of responsive design, UX, and current social and digital technology trends to push the boundaries in every project.
* Effectively present and communicate ideas with both clients and team members, confidently leading discussions and fostering a collaborative, low-ego environment that values feedback and iteration.
* Show a keen interest in emerging technologies like AI, and possess advanced motion and video skills using After Effects and Premiere to design innovative solutions.
* Execute projects from concept to completion, exhibiting stellar communication, organisational, and time management skills while enjoying a hands-on approach with team collaboration.
* Apply comprehensive branding knowledge, ensuring consistency and quality across all forms of media.
* Experience in consumer goods, luxury, or drinks & beverages sectors preferred.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.
