title: Produktägare Data och analys
description:
**Allt vi gör, gör vi för Umeå.**


Våra energi- och kommunikationslösningar spelar en stor roll i våra kunders vardag, varje dag. Hos oss arbetar du med samhällsviktiga tjänster och bidrar till utvecklingen av en hållbar region. Vi erbjuder en varierad yrkesroll där du får möjligheter att utvecklas och växa tillsammans med oss, samtidigt som du bibehåller en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Självklart ingår en rad förmåner med fokus på att du ska må bra.

**Om rollen**  

Energibranschen står inför en digital transformation där data är en nyckel. Som **Product Owner för Dataanalys & Datalager** blir du en drivande kraft i vår resa mot att bli en datadriven organisation. Du ansvarar för att omsätta affärsbehov till datadrivna lösningar och leder utvecklingen tillsammans med utvecklare, analytiker och konsulter i ett agilt team.


Du blir länken mellan verksamhet och teknik – och säkerställer att våra satsningar bidrar till både affärsvärde och energiomställning.

**Du kommer att att arbeta med att:**

* Definiera och kommunicera visionen för dataanalys och datalager.
* Prioritera och hantera backlogg tillsammans med teamet
* Omvandla affärsbehov till tekniska krav och lösningar.
* Samarbeta med intressenter på olika nivåer i organisationen.
* Utforska nya teknologier och driva innovation inom BI-området.
* Stödja verksamheten i att förstå och använda data för insikter och förbättringar.


Du är strategisk och ser helheten, men kan också gå ner i detaljer när det behövs. Du är kommunikativ, handlingskraftig och trivs i en miljö som präglas av förändring. Med nyfikenhet, innovationsförmåga och intresse för hållbarhet vill du bidra till en grönare framtid med hjälp av data.

 **För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha:**

* Minst 2 års erfarenhet som Product Owner, Product Manager eller motsvarande inom IT eller analys.
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder (Scrum, SAFe eller Kanban).
* Förmåga att översätta affärsbehov till tekniska krav och prioritera backloggen effektivt.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera flera intressenter och driva datadrivna initiativ.
* Starka kommunikations- och ledaregenskaper.

**Det är ett plus om du oxå har erfarenhet av:**

* Molnplattformar (Azure, AWS, GCP).
* Microsoft SQL Server, Power BI eller liknande verktyg.
* BI, datalager och dataplattformar.
* AI, avancerad analys eller DevOps-verktyg (Azure DevOps/Jira).
* Certifiering som CSPO/SAFe PO eller liknande.


Vi förväntar oss inte att du uppfyller allt på plus-listan, utan ser dem som en vägledning för vad rollen innebär. Det viktigaste är att du uppfyller de grundläggande kraven och har en nyfikenhet och vilja att utvecklas inom området. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av några av de meriterande områdena, men vi värderar också potential och intresse högt.

 **Är du vår nästa Product Owner?** Hos oss får du vara en del av ett samhällsviktigt bolag i en spännande bransch i förändring. Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att påverka och driva den datadrivna utvecklingen framåt. Här får du arbeta med engagerade kollegor i en dynamisk organisation som sätter hållbarhet och innovation i fokus.

**Ansök senast: 2025-09-30**

**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan! Urval sker löpande, så vänta inte för länge – tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag**

  

För mer information om tjänsten kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Oscar Mo, 076-118 87 12. Fackliga företrädare når du via vår växel, 090-16 00 00.


Som samhällsviktig verksamhet är det viktigt för oss med en trygg arbetsmiljö för våra medarbetare samt att våra tillgångar och information är skyddade. Några av våra roller kräver säkerhetsprövning, om det är aktuellt för tjänsten du sökt så kommer du att få mer information kring det i ett senare skede.


På jobb.umeaenergi.se kan du läsa mer om våra drivkrafter och utmaningar, samt ta del av några av våra medarbetares vardag.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced DevOps engineer who wants to enhance security and performance through reliable and scalable solutions.


You will work closely with architects and engineers to run applications and services on AWS, build and maintain integrations in our CI/CD ecosystem, and support product teams in effectively utilizing the platform. You will also identify bottlenecks, drive improvements, and shape how we deliver critical services at enterprise scale.

**About You**


You are a customer-focused DevOps engineer with a strong background in AWS and modern CI/CD practices. You enjoy simplifying complex problems, thrive in collaborative environments, and take ownership of solutions from design to delivery.

**Requirements:**

* 7+ years of experience with **AWS cloud architecture and operations**
* Solid background in **CI/CD pipelines**, automation, and monitoring
* Hands-on experience with **containerization and Kubernetes**
* Knowledge of **Infrastructure as Code** (Terraform, CloudFormation, CDK, or similar)
* Good understanding of **secure and reliable system design**
* Fluent English, spoken and written

  

We are looking for individuals who are passionate about technology and want to improve our ways of working and solutions. With us, you will have the opportunity to work with leading technology companies and explore new technologies in a supportive and innovative environment.


We look forward to hearing from you!

title: AWS Cloud Architect
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Architect and deliver secure, global AWS environments for enterprise-scale, mission-critical services.
* Continuously improve infrastructure through automation, cost optimization, performance, and reliability.
* Define and enforce cloud architecture standards, patterns, and best practices across the enterprise.
* Ensure security, compliance, and governance in multi-account, multi-region AWS environments.
* Design and support modern microservice architectures, including secure and scalable API integrations with API Gateway and related technologies.
* Act as a trusted advisor to development teams, enabling scalable solutions with CloudFormation, CDK, and serverless technologies.
* Proactively troubleshoot and resolve complex cloud issues.
* Support and mentor colleagues, fostering knowledge-sharing, team growth, and consistent delivery excellence.
* Evaluate and adopt new AWS services and emerging cloud technologies, driving enterprise innovation.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Strong background in AWS cloud architecture & development (5+ years preferred).
* Skilled in Python, Bash, TypeScript, and IaC (CloudFormation, CDK).
* Hands-on experience with serverless services, IAM/SSO, and AWS Organizations (Control Tower, StackSets, Service Catalog).
* Very good understanding of exposing and integrating modern microservice architectures using API Gateway, Lambda, Step Functions, and related services.
* Proven ability to deliver 24/7 enterprise-scale services and manage CI/CD pipelines.
* Passion for cloud innovation, industry trends, and best practices.
* AWS Certifications (Solutions Architect Pro, Security, DevOps).
* Experience with event-driven architectures, Agile/DevOps workflows.
* Open-source contributions or personal development projects.
* Swedish language skills.

  

**Application deadline:** 03-09-2025 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Operations Engineer Cloud
description:
**Om oss!** 




 Vimla är inte någon klassisk telekomoperatör. Vi är en del i Telenor-familjen som erbjuder mobiltelefoni med en twist! Vi tar kundfokus, enkelhet och schyssthet till en ny nivå på den svenska mobilmarknaden och i vårt team. Vi tänker på kunden först och vill att det ska vara enkelt och roligt att vara kund hos oss.
 







 Vi är Vimla - mobiloperatören med bra vibrationer! Nu har du chansen att joina teamet i rollen som Operations Engineer Cloud, ta chansen och sök nu.
 







**Vad du kommer att göra** 




 I rollen som Operations Engineer Cloud i Vimlas tekniska driftsteam kommer du att vara en nyckelspelare med ansvar för att säkerställa en smidig och framtidssäkrad drift med fokus på vår molnplattform (AWS). Du leder förändringsprojekt från idé till genomförande och uppföljning, samtidigt som du samarbetar nära med kollegor inom hela organisationen; utvecklingsteam, arkitekter, leverantörer och partners.
 







 Vi moderniserar vår infrastruktur där AWS är en central komponent, och ditt bidrag blir avgörande för resan. Ditt ansvar innefattar även att underhålla våra interna tjänster, stötta kollegor i tekniska frågor och ingå i beredskap för interna system och integrationer. Rollen innebär stor påverkan och möjlighet att både bidra med idéer och utmana vårt sätt att arbeta.
 



  




* Hantera projekt, både interna och med partners och/eller leverantörer
* Samarbeta med alla inom Vimla för att förstå behov och prioritera projekt
* Arbeta med våra arkitekter för att säkerställa god systemutveckling
* Hitta och analysera problem som uppstår.



  





**Vi söker dig som har** 




 Vi söker dig som har en utbildning i datavetenskap eller motsvarande erfarenhet och god kunskap och erfarenhet av AWS-miljöer inklusive nätverksinfrastruktur (AWS VPC). Du känner dig trygg i Linux-miljö samt att arbeta med SQL (Oracle, Postgres), övervakningsverktyg som Splunk. Har du dessutom erfarenhet av telco-stacks, Shell-scripting eller Python ser vi det som ett stort plus. Vi ser gärna att du utmanar oss i vårt sätt att arbeta, och har med fördel erfarenhet av att genomföra förbättringar baserat på datadrivna beslut.
 







 Du är en problemlösare som trivs i mindre team där samarbete och eget ansvar går hand i hand. Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och gillar att bidra med nya perspektiv. Framför allt söker vi dig som är nyfiken, ambitiös och vill vara med och utveckla både våra tekniska lösningar.
 







**Varför du vill jobba på Vimla** 




 Vimla är på en spännande tillväxtresa och möjligheterna att växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss är enorma. Vi är ett roligt, tight team på runt 40 personer i en egen organisation. Samtidigt är Vimla en del av Telenor Sverige och använder tryggheten som finns i ett stort bolag.
 







**Ansök idag!** 




 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Telenor med Experis IT, som har lång erfarenhet av att rekrytera IT-specialister och chefer.
 







 Om du har frågor eller vill ha mer information är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsulterna Anki Snis på
 **anki.snis@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 70-377 59 69, och Carina Eyoma på
 **carina.eyoma@se.experis.com** 
 , +46 73-086 22 75.
 



 Urval sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
 



  





 Vi ser fram emot att ta del av din ansökan!
 



  





**Bra att veta** 




 I enlighet med Telenors policy genomför vi en bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidater i alla rekryteringar.
 



 Plats: Solna

title: DevOps Engineer
company_industry: Truck Transportation and Railroad Equipment Manufacturing
description:
Req ID:491376
   

  

 At Alstom, we understand transport networks and what moves people. From high-speed trains, metros, monorails, and trams, to turnkey systems, services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility, we offer our diverse customers the broadest portfolio in the industry. Every day, more than 80 000 colleagues lead the way to greener and smarter mobility worldwide, connecting cities as we reduce carbon and replace cars.
   

  

**Could you be the full time DevOps Engineer we are looking for in Stockholm or Hässleholm?**
**Your future role**
 You will work with around 30 software developers spread out over three locations (Stockholm, Hässleholm and Bangkok). There is also a possibility to support other teams in the global organisation. The major application we develop, is web based and running in Microsoft Azure. It consists of several applications which in turn is developed and maintained by different teams. The teams have some DevOps responsibilities which is supported by one person having the central DevOps responsibility. We are now looking for you that can spend 50% of your time to strengthen the central DevOps responsibility and the other 50% on Java back-end development (Spring Boot). As a developer, you will belong to one of the excellent application teams. We work in an agile style with backlogs and sprints. Each team has a team-lead, and the team is interacting with, architects, UX designers, Product- and Program managers. As a developer, you will need to analyse problems, create designs and do the implementation work.
   

  

**We will look to you for:**
* Maintain and optimize our build and test environment.
* Support with configuration of Azure resources.
* Be the interface towards the IT team that provides the Azure resources.
* Support developers with software integrations.
* Manage branching strategies.
* Maintain the version control systems.
* Release our applications in a timely manner.


**All About You**
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science or any other relevant specialization.
* Proven experience in Microsoft Azure cloud computing platform.
* Experience in scripting and build automation in Gitlab and Azure DevOps.
* Strong experience in Git version control software and CI/CD.
* Experience in Linux and Java (Spring Boot).
* Experience from using Agile methodologies.
* Excellent team player and a good communicator.
* English at a fluent level is mandatory for this role. Swedish is meritorious.
* Meritorious to have experience in containerization using Docker and Kubernetes.
* Meritorious to have Artifactory experience.


**Things you’ll enjoy**
 Join us on a life-long transformative journey – the rail industry is here to stay, so you can grow and develop new skills and experiences throughout your career. You’ll also:
   

  

* Enjoy stability, challenges and a long-term career free from boring daily routines
* Collaborate with transverse teams and helpful colleagues
* Contribute to innovative projects
* Utilise our agile way of working environment
* Steer your career in whatever direction you choose across functions and countries
* Benefit from our investment in your development, through award-winning learning
* Benefit from a fair and dynamic reward package that recognises your performance and potential, plus comprehensive and competitive social coverage (life, medical, pension)


 You don’t need to be a train enthusiast to thrive with us. We guarantee that when you step onto one of our trains with your friends or family, you’ll be proud. If you’re up for the challenge, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**Important to note**
 As a global business, we’re an equal-opportunity employer that celebrates diversity across the 63 countries we operate in. We’re committed to creating an inclusive workplace for everyone.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
**About Us:** 




 At Dabster, we specialize in connecting top talent with leading global companies. We are currently seeking a skilled and dedicated
 **Cloud Architect** 
 to join our client's team, anywhere in
 **Stockholm, Sweden.** 
 Our mission is to be the foremost recruitment specialist in securing exceptional talent for a diverse range of global clients.
 



  





**Who You Will Work With:** 




 Our client is a globally recognized technology company delivering IT services, consulting, and business solutions. They partner with leading organizations worldwide to drive digital transformation, leveraging innovation and deep industry expertise to solve complex business challenges.
 



  





**Job Description:** 



* As an experienced Cloud architect designed, and developed a landing zone, and cloud foundation for more than three clients.
* As an experienced IaaC developer used Terraform and build frameworks using Python, bash, and jinja templates to handle CI/CD pipeline.
* As an experienced DevOps engineer used cloud-native DevOps, which includes AzureDevops, GCP Cloud build.
* Expertise in developing k8s cluster from scratch and deploying microservices. Also, containerise monolith application and host on k8s environment.
* Expertise in developing microservices containers, also migrating Java monolith in microservices architecture and deploying in k8s.
* Extensive experience in working with cloud solutions such as AWS, Azure, GCP and OpenStack, created, administered, and deployed Kubernetes clusters on them.
* Experience is leading a team of junior resources where mentor and upskill them/
* Extensive experience using terraform GCP specially focused on Kubernetes engines such as EKS, GKE, and AKS.
* Extensive experience setting up data pipelines using Kinesis, Lambda, Glue, S3, Athena on AWS and Cloud Composer, Data Fusion, Data Proc, Big Query, and GCS on GCP.
* Set up CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins, Team City and Octopus Deploy. Also set up release pipelines as well release management process using Git Workflow and Git Hub Workflow model.
* Define processes to set up a DevOps culture with the development team and release management.
* Development experience in technologies such as Java, Python, Groovy, C#, and typescript(anguler2).
* Extensive experience in integrating different systems (JIRA, Confluence, Git, Nexus, Jenkins/Team City, Octopus Deploy) to a unified release process which can be controlled or distrusted by the development team.
* Over 3 years of experience working with Ansible, Chef and Puppet to provision machines on-prem and cloud solutions such as AWS and GCP.
* Experience working with OpenShift, Vagrant-based Kubernetes clusters as defining on-prem clusters and virtual machines.
* Experience in working with Storage solutions such as NFS and Glusterfs Cluster which have developed and integrated with K8s environment as well plain Linux VMs.



  





**How to Apply** 




 Apply by submitting your resume today, showcasing your relevant experience and passion for the position via LinkedIn Easy Apply or directly to
 **james.a@dabster.net**

title: DevOps Engineer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Financial Services
description:
Here at Billogram, we believe that treating people well always pays off. We like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time, rather than from missed payments. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain points and be beneficial to both our clients and their customers, improving their relationships. We're looking for a talented DevOps Engineer to join our team and help us shape the future of billing!
 



  





**About the Rol** 
 e
 



 We’re looking for an Infrastructure Engineer who enjoys keeping things running smoothly and supporting our growing product. If you enjoy working with a team to solve practical challenges, enabling developers with better tools, you’ll fit right in. We want someone humble, pragmatic, and eager to learn: excited to fit into the team, take part in discussions, and explore new technologies together. You’ll join colleagues who value cooperation to ensure our platform stays stable and secure.
 



  





 This is a hybrid position, and you can be based at either our Stockholm or Bucharest office. A valid visa or work permit is required, with no relocation assistance offered.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* **Develop and maintain infrastructure** 
 : Ensure the underlying infrastructure is up and running and supports the product optimally as we grow with more customers.
* **Support Developers** 
 : Enable teams to build and deploy services efficiently and securely, including optimizing CI/CD pipelines.
* **Secure the Platform** 
 : Keep the platform secure, monitor systems, and assist in resolving incidents to maintain stability.
* **Optimize Processes** 
 : Enhance testing and deployment workflows to improve the development experience and remov
 **osos**
* **Collaborate** 
 : Work with engineering teams, share knowledge, and contribute to strategies that benefit everyone.



  





**Key Qualifications** 



* Three or more years working with cloud infrastructure, preferably AWS.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes
* A security-minded approach to all tasks, emphasizing technical safety.
* Pragmatic mindset for solving issues, delivering results, and participating in team discussions.



  





**Bonus Skills** 



* Working knowledge of databases.
* Experience with building, monitoring, and alerting on logs and metrics
* Knowledge of a technical scripting language, preferably Python or Bash.
* Experience building and maintaining CI/CD pipelines.
* Hands-on experience in Terraform or Terragrunt.



  





**Why Work with Us?** 




 At Billogram, we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. Beyond that, you will get lots of freedom and opportunity to develop together with great colleagues at our office, right in the center of Stockholm. We also offer flexible working hours, exciting challenges, and a supportive and fun work environment.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation. At Billogram, our inclusive and diverse culture ensures that everyone can enjoy a fulfilling career and a great work-life balance.
 



  





 This recruitment process is managed internally, and we respectfully request no contact from recruitment agencies.
 



  





 At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.
 



  





 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Test Automation Specialist | SEB Life, Stockholm
description:
Join us as an Automation Test Engineer to enhance Lumera's testing, ensuring performance and seamless integration with our IT systems.
   

  

 Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress toward a sustainable tomorrow. Life & Pension in SEB is one of the largest pensions and insurance providers in Sweden, serving both corporate and private customers. As part of our team, you’ll benefit from a small company’s agility and a large company’s resources, offering opportunities to influence and grow.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Lumera is built on Java while the majority of our in-house systems are developed in C#. As our Automation Test Engineer, your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Developing automated tests: Create and maintain automated tests to validate Lumera’s functionality, performance, and integration with other systems.
* Implementing test frameworks: Select and integrate appropriate test frameworks and tools to support efficient automated testing. Potential frameworks include JUnit, TestNG, Pytest, or other relevant tools based on the chosen language.
* Collaborating across teams: Work closely with other developers and stakeholders to identify testing requirements and ensure test coverage.
* Analyzing test results: Investigate and document test outcomes, identifying issues and suggesting improvements.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* You have proven experience in software development, with a strong foundation in Java, C#, or similar programming languages.
* Experience with test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, JUnit, TestNG, Pytest) and tools for CI/CD pipelines.
* Familiarity with testing methodologies, including functional, integration, and performance testing.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an attention to detail.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and verbal.
* Experience working with Lumera or similar insurance administration systems is a plus.


**What We Offer**
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions, and points of view


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome with your application! Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 14th of September 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact IT Manager Laban Bondesson at laban.bondesson@seb.se.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe, or where they come from.
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: GitOps Engineering Manager
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open-source software and operating systems for global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in more than 80 countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring a
 **GitOps Engineering Manager** 
 aspiring for a world-class devops and gitops engineering management challenge, bringing together operations management, software engineering and product development, and team leadership in a single high-value role. You will need to be a Linux and operations expert, as well as a great manager capable of leading a high-performance team, to excel in this role.
   

  

 Our mission is to pioneer and prove new and better approaches to large-scale IS. We support Canonical and Ubuntu operations, but we also help shape Canonical's managed application service offerings, raising the bar on devops and cloud-native operations. We take infra-as-code to the next level, blazing a trail to next-generation model-driven operations. We not only aim to automate every process that underpins our business, we also share that automation as open source packages which others use to drive their own operations.
   

  

 We work across the full stack, from bare metal to Kubernetes, including cloud and virtualisation. We also work across the full range of infrastructure, from public cloud to private cloud and edge.
   

  

 We have fully distributed, home-based teams in EMEA, APAC and the Americas. You will lead a team in your time zone, and report to a global director who may not be in your time zone.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role will be based remotely in the APAC region.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Lead your team in daily agile devops practices
* Represent the IS team to stakeholders, customers, and internal teams
* Organize, coordinate and drive internal projects
* Mentor engineers to improve their skills
* Identify and measure team health indicators
* Implement structured engineering and operations processes
* Ensure proper team focus on priorities, milestones, and deliverables
* Work to meet service level agreements with customer deployments around the globe
* Deliver quality managed services in a consistent, timely manner


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Proven experience of software delivery using infrastructure as code
* Proven experience managing devops teams for SAAS or similar offerings
* Understanding of testing methodologies and maintainable code quality
* Technical aptitude for understanding complex distributed systems
* Experience with cloud topologies and technologies
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long
* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university


**Nice-to-have skills**
* Experience with Ubuntu system administration
* Experience with agile software development methodologies
* Experience working in and managing distributed teams


 What we offer colleagues
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: (Senior) Integration Automation Engineer – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support. The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services – Group Digital Office Directorate (GCS-GDO) – Platforms & Services Department (P&S) – Integration Division (INT) – Integration Platform Services Unit (IPSU) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **(Senior) Integration Automation Engineer\*** 
 .
   

  

**This is a full time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications


*Panel interviews are foreseen as from May 2025.*
 Purpose
   

  

 Are you passionate about enhancing efficiency, speed and reliability in software delivery? You will play a crucial role by breaking down traditional silos between development and operations teams, and weaving seamlessly security practices into the software development lifecycle?
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report directly to the Head of Unit and will work in close contact with the unit’s Platform Leads and with the other IT units.
   

  

 The Unit focuses on providing and managing integration services, providing integration platforms that play a crucial role in connecting diverse applications, systems, and data sources within an organization to ensure seamless communication and data flow.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Architect, design, and implement CI/CD pipelines
* Implement Infrastructure as Code practices to automate the provisioning and configuration of development, testing, and production environments. Leverage tools like Terraform or Ansible to ensure consistency across environments.
* Design and implement automation of cloud-native services (e.g., AWS Lambda, Azure Functions, API Gateway) to reduce operational complexity and enhance system resilience.
* Collaborate with development and quality assurance teams to integrate automated testing into CI/CD pipelines.
* Implement automated deployment processes to deliver software releases consistently and reliably.
* Continuously optimize and enhance CI/CD processes to improve build and deployment efficiency.
* Implement and manage automated security testing tools and processes to seamlessly integrate security into the CI/CD pipeline and ensure continuous compliance.
* Promote a security-conscious culture by providing training and awareness programs.
* Review analysis and proposed technical solutions prepared by more junior staff for consistency with business and functional requirements and IT plans in order to assess technical and business feasibility.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related disciplines.
* Minimum 5 years of experience in integration automation, cloud engineering, or infrastructure automation, with strong background in software development including the supervision of technical teams.
* Experience with cloud services and platforms, such as AWS and/or Azure. Understanding of cloud security best practices and securing applications and data in cloud.
* Extensive experience with CI/CD tools such as Azure DevOps, Jenkins, GitLab CI, Travis CI, CircleCI, or others.
* Experience in integration concepts, such as API, event streaming, SOA and ESB would be a nice to have.
* Experience with automation tools such as Maven, Gradle, npm, Ansible, Puppet, or Chef would be a nice to have.
* Strong experience with infrastructure-as-code (IaC) principles, using tools like Terraform.
* Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes as nice to have.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python, Ruby, or Bash as nice to have.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

*This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.*

title: Infrastructure Engineer - Linux
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Förvalta och vidareutveckla vår Linux-miljö
* Arbeta med virtualisering (VMware), nätverk och lagring
* Samarbeta tätt med kollegor inom IT-säkerhet, utveckling och support


 Att jobba som Infrastructure Engineer - Linux
   

  

 Vi söker nu en Infrastructure Engineer med fokus på Linux som vill vara med och bygga vidare på vår tekniska plattform och bidra till att leverera Sveriges bästa bolåneupplevelse. Hos oss får du arbeta i ett snabbfotat tech-team där innovation, säkerhet och automatisering står i centrum.
   

  

 Som Infrastructure Engineer - Linux blir du en nyckelperson i vårt Tech Operations-team som brinner för teknik, samarbete och ständig förbättring.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Delta i drift och utveckling av vår Kubernetesplattform
* Automatisera med Ansible, Pipelines och scriptning (t.ex. Bash, Python)
* Bidra till ständig förbättring av våra system och processer


 Vi söker dig som är en passionerad Linux-entusiast med bred teknisk kompetens och ett stort engagemang för ditt arbete. Du har gedigen erfarenhet av Linux och OS-nära tjänster, och du är van att arbeta i komplexa, säkra och högtilgängliga miljöer. Du har goda kunskaper i Ansible, scriptning samt versionshantering med Git. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av Kubernetes och containerteknik. Som person är du ansvarstagande, självgående och prestigelös. Du tar initiativ, är lösningsorienterad och trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och bidrar till teamets gemensamma framgång.
   

  

 Vår arbetsplatsstrategi är en hybridlösning mellan att jobba hemma och arbeta från vårt ljusa och luftiga kontor i Solna Business Park med härlig atmosfär, där vi bland annat har gym, cykelparkering inomhus och det bästa: vår egen barista. Rollen kräver att du talar svenska.
   

  

 Då det är semestertider kommer vi att börja gå igenom ansökningarna efter sommaren – tack för ditt tålamod och vi ser fram emot att läsa din ansökan!
   

  

 Har du check på allt?
   

  

* Ansvarstagande
* Bra på att prioritera
* Förändringsbenägen
* Kommunikativ
* Nyfiken


 Annars då?

title: Security Engineer
description:
**TL;DR** 
 – We’re looking for a Security Engineer to raise the bar for how fast-moving AI teams stay secure. You’ll work with infra, ML, and product teams to protect our stack without slowing us down. This is a high-leverage role for someone who wants to build security into the core of everything we ship.
   

  

**Why Lovable?**
 Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.
   

  

 We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience securing modern cloud-native environments, ideally at product-focused tech companies or early-stage startups or top-tier AI labs.
* Deep knowledge of securing engineering infrastructure: CI/CD pipelines, secrets, service-to-service auth, containerized environments, and public cloud.
* Strong systems mindset - you're comfortable diving into infra code, writing tools, and contributing directly to engineering workflows.
* Track record and intuition to design pragmatic security controls that don’t slow teams down.
* Bonus: You’ve shipped internal security tools or open-sourced relevant infra.


**What You’ll Do**
**In one sentence:** 
 Help us build and ship AI products at extremely high velocity without compromising on security.
   

  

* Identify high-leverage surfaces across Lovable’s engineering stack, from CI/CD and auth to product endpoints.
* Design and implement tooling that helps developers go the secure route by default.
* Own detection, triage, and response for vulnerabilities and incidents - internal and external.
* Collaborate with infra, ML, platform and product engineers to embed security into everything we build.
* Track emerging risks in AI infra, LLM pipelines, and third-party integrations, and close the gaps before they matter.


**Our tech stack**
 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
   

  

* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Google Cloud, AWS, Terraform
* DevOps & Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, observability, infra-as-code


 And always on the lookout for what's next!
   

  

**How We Hire**
* Fill in a short form then jump on an intro call with the team.
* Complete the take-home exercise
* Show us how you approach problems during two technical interviews
* Join us for trial work lasting 2 days preferably on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.


**About Your Application**
* Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
description:
🚀 Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer – Stockholm (Hybrid)
 



  





**Be the First. Build the Future.** 




  





 Our client - a fast-growing SaaS innovator used by global enterprises - is launching a brand-new AI initiative. They’re looking for a
 **Senior Fullstack GenAI Engineer** 
 to be the founding member of this team and lead the charge in embedding cutting-edge AI into their product suite.
 



  





 🧠 What You’ll Do
 



 As the first dedicated AI engineer, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of AI within the company. This is a hands-on, high-impact role where you’ll:
 



  




* **Architect and build** 
 AI-powered features and infrastructure from the ground up.
* **Design and implement** 
 GenAI tools and agentic workflows - think chatbots, LLMs, RAG pipelines, and more.
* **Collaborate closely** 
 with product and engineering leadership to define the AI roadmap and long-term vision.
* **Prototype and productionise** 
 AI features that enhance user experience and drive product innovation.
* **Evaluate and integrate** 
 technologies like AWS Bedrock and other GenAI platforms to accelerate development.
* **Influence architectural decisions** 
 in a microservices-based environment, ensuring scalability and performance.
* **Mentor and guide** 
 future hires as the AI team grows around you.



  





 🛠️ What You Bring
 



 This isn’t a role for a pure data scientist or MLOps specialist. We’re looking for a well-rounded software engineer with a passion for AI and a track record of building real-world products. You’ll need:
 



  




* A strong background in
 **software engineering -** 
 beneficial if this is full-stack exp.
* Experience building and integrating
 **GenAI solutions** 
 into production environments.
* Proficiency in
 **Node.js/TypeScript** 
 , with additional experience in
 **Python** 
 ,
 **Go** 
 , or
 **PHP** 
 .
* Familiarity with
 **AWS** 
 (especially Bedrock);
 **GCP** 
 experience is also welcome.
* Solid understanding of
 **LLMs** 
 ,
 **RAG** 
 , and
 **agentic AI workflows** 
 .
* Experience working in
 **microservice architectures** 
 .
* A proactive, collaborative mindset and the ability to thrive in a fast-moving, startup-style environment.



  





 🌍 Why Join?
 


* **Greenfield opportunity** 
 : Be the first hire in a brand-new AI team with huge growth potential.
* **Impact** 
 : Your work will directly shape the future of the product and the company’s AI capabilities.
* **Flexibility** 
 : Hybrid working model in Stockholm - on-site a few days a week for collaboration.
* **Compensation** 
 : Competitive salary.
* **Benefits** 
 : 30 days’ holiday, wellness and home office allowances, ITP1 pension, and more.
* **Culture** 
 : A supportive, people-first environment with a flat structure and strong engineering culture.



  





 This is a rare opportunity to join a company at the start of its AI journey and make a lasting impact. If you're excited by the idea of building something from scratch and leading the way in GenAI innovation - this is your moment.
 



  





**Apply now and help our client shape the future of AI.**

title: Software Engineer - Installation & Customer Care
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Software Engineer on our Installations & Customer Care team, you’ll shape how clean energy gets delivered by designing and building the digital backbone for our field workforce. This is not just about coding features — it’s about engineering systems that replace manual, fragmented workflows with scalable, data-driven solutions.
   

  

 You’ll work at the intersection of software and real-world operations, driving technical decisions that directly impact installers, technicians, and customers. From architecting services that streamline collaboration to scaling infrastructure across new regions, you’ll own discovery as much as delivery, ensuring the tools we build solve the right problems at scale.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Own end-to-end design and implementation of systems that bring structure, efficiency, and traceability to field operations
* Architect intelligent tools that replace manual paperwork and disconnected workflows with scalable digital solutions
* Build services that simplify collaboration and handovers between installers, planners, and support teams, reducing friction across the customer journey
* Leverage operational data to design platforms that surface insights, drive continuous improvement, and guide smarter decision-making at scale
* Design resilient infrastructure that empowers a traditionally non-digital workforce to rely on intuitive tools in their daily work
* Support proactive maintenance, diagnostics, and revisit scheduling to improve long-term customer outcomes
* Scale systems into new regions and markets, adapting to diverse requirements, work practices, and service models


 We’re changing how clean energy is installed and maintained — making it smarter, faster, and better for everyone involved. If you thrive on discovery, solving complex problems, and building systems that empower people in the field, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Extensive experience in product-driven software development within agile environments
* Strong knowledge of React and TypeScript
* Solid experience with Java or another object-oriented language
* Proven ability in automated testing at different levels (unit, integration, etc.)
* Ability to balance hands-on coding with architectural thinking and technical leadership


**Nice to have**
* Experience in rapid growth environments (startups, scaleups, new markets)
* Databases (DynamoDB, PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, logging, metrics)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Terraform
* Kanban, Scrum, or hybrid workflows
* Digitalization of manual labor / operational modernization
* Spring Boot framework experience


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Senior Teknisk Testare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Minst 4 år i aktuell roll
* Du ska ha minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att självständigt etablera och arbeta med ramverk för testautomatisering i agila utvecklingsteam.
* Du ska ha minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att skapa automatiserade GUI-, regressionstester och flödestester (del- och helflöden) i komplexa användarscenarier med Playwright.
* Du ska ha minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att skriva och underhålla API-tester, inklusive autentisering och hantering av headers.
* Du ska ha minst 3 års dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta med versionshantering i Git och/eller Bitbucket.


**Meriterande**
* PEGA-plattformen: Som DevOps-stöd (tCI/CD, Pega samt arbete med testautomatisering i PEGA-baserade applikationer, prestandatestning and API-testing i PEGA-applikationer gärna inom offentlig sektor eller större organisationer
* Du har arbetat med teststrategier för automatisering i plattformsbaserade lösningar (lowcode/no-code) Erfarenhet av att dokumentera fram teststrategier för automatisering, inklusive val av verktyg och ramverk, anpassade till teamets sprintplanering och arbetssätt
* Du har arbetat med test som en integrerad del av teamets leveransansvar, inklusive coachning i testautomatisering på PEGA-plattformen och formulering av testbara acceptanskriterier i planeringsstadiet


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 04-09-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Integrationsutvecklare - sökes till Accelerate at Iver
description:
*Nu letar vi efter nya medarbetare som vill vara med på vår resa. Som en del av Accelerate at Iver ligger du i teknikens absoluta framkant och arbetar med spännande digitaliserings- och transformationsprojekt hos marknadsledande kunder. Vi är idag över 300 konsulter som brinner för att realisera digitala möjligheter i molnet. Tillsammans med våra kunder stänger vi gapet mellan aspiration och framgångsrik implementation. Nu söker vi en Integrationsutvecklare som vill bli en del av Accelerate at Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?*
**Din roll** 
**på Accelerate at Iver?**
 Som integrationsutvecklare hos Accelerate at Iver kommer du att bidra till att bygga robusta, moderna och långsiktiga integrationslösningar. Lösningarna byggs främst på Microsoft-teknologi, både cloud och on-prem.
   

  

 Vi söker en social och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett stort driv och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken.
   

  

 Vill du vara en del av vårt team och bidra till att bygga framtidens integrationslösningar?
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Utveckling & Implementering: Erfarenhet av att ta fram teknisk och funktionell design för integrationslösningar. Samarbeta med integrationsarkitekter för att utveckla lösningar som uppfyller både verksamhetsmål och tekniska principer.
* Kodkvalitet & Optimering: Säkerställ högkvalitativ, underhållbar och återanvändbar kod. Förbättra befintliga integrationer för att uppnå bättre skalbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda.
* Samarbete: Arbeta självständigt eller i team tillsammans med bland annat projektledare, arkitekter, testare och produktägare.
* Support & Underhåll: Bidra till det löpande underhållet och utvecklingen av integrationslösningar.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Accelerate at Iver kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.
   

  

 Hos Accelerate at Iver får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med C#, .Net Core och Microservices i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.
   

  

 Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik.
   

  

 Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver får du ett antal fördelar som:
   

  

* En trygg och säker anställning
* Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
* Friskvårdsbidrag
* Hälso & sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Pensions och försäkringsrådgivning
* Förmånsportal
* Timbank & volontärdag
* Medarbetar och familjeaktiviteter i olika former


**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
 Erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknologier som:
   

  

* C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework, XML, JSON, REST-APIer, Biceps
* Azure Integration Services: Logic Apps, Service Bus, Azure Functions, Azure API Management
* SQL Server, Azure SQL
* Azure, men meriterande med erfarenhet av andra plattformar såsom BizTalk, Mulesoft eller andra plattformar


 Kunskap om verktyg som Microsoft Visual Studio/Visual Studio Code, Postman, Git och Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Minst 2–4 års erfarenhet inom integrationsutveckling
   

  

 Du bör ha jobbat i agila team med scrum- eller kanban som arbetssätt, och vara van vid de olika rollerna och rollfördelningen som ett sådant arbetssätt innebär.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.
   

  

 Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!
   

  

 För denna position krävs Svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Stockholm.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Accelerate at Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!
   

  

 Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

 Är du vår nya kollega?

title: Full Stack Engineer - Python/Typescript (Contractor)
description:
**What We Should Tell You About The Company**
 Filed is building the
 **first AI tax preparer** 
 trusted by America’s accounting firms. This industry might seem boring—but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it—fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit
 **strong product-market fit** 
 , are generating insanely
 **fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue** 
 , and are
 **backed by top-tier investors** 
 . We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future with expanding our already 30 person team, with those who want to say
 **“I was there when it all started.”**
 https://techcrunch.com/2025/05/21/filed-raises-17m-to-automate-the-drudgery-of-tax-prep/
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
 We’re looking for a full-stack engineer who moves fast and thrives in high-velocity environments. You’re the kind of person who sees a broken workflow, understands the root cause quickly, and ships a fix in hours—not weeks. You love turning ambiguity into working software, and you don’t wait around for perfect specs to start building.
   

  

 You’re a generalist who’s just as comfortable spinning up a backend service as you are crafting a clean, responsive UI. You sweat the details, but never let them block progress. You think in terms of speed, value, and iteration—always asking: how can we get this in front of users faster?
   

  

 As one of our earliest engineers, you’ll help shape the core product and infrastructure. You’ll work closely with design, ML, and actual tax pros to reinvent how this industry works—by shipping fast, learning fast, and doing what others said couldn’t be done.
   

  

 Our product and engineering team is based in
 **Stockholm** 
 . We’re prioritising local candidates, but will
 **consider candidates from elsewhere in the EU, who can travel to Stockholm.**
 ⸻
   

  

**Here’s Why This Is a Terrible Job**
* This is not a job for someone who likes to move slow.
* We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re going in the wrong direction, but more times than not we’re going in the right direction.
* If you need a few extra days to perfect your code, chances are there’s already a handful of team members blocked behind you.
* We use tools like Cursor to move fast, test ideas in days, and ship extremely fast.
* You’ll be operating at the intersection of product logic, machine learning, user psychology, and highly regulated workflows.
* There are no clear answers. Just judgment calls, ambiguity, and constant input from every direction.
* You’ll ask yourself, is this really the work? It is. And it’s not for everyone.


 ⸻
   

  

**Here's Why It's The Best Career Choice You'll Make**
* We’re building what tax pros call impossible. A product that behaves like a teammate, not just another tool.
* We run reviews every 4 months. We operate with total transparency around pay, performance, and progress.
* You’ll be paid above market. You’ll earn equity that grows fast. And you’ll have full autonomy to make high-impact decisions.
* You’ll ship code because you believe in it, not because it got signed off.
* You’ll talk to customers weekly. You’ll drive outcomes end to end.
* We’ll tell you what needs to be achieved. How you get there is on you.
* We expect you to build a customer Oracle. An internal simulator so dialed in that you can predict exactly what your user needs before you ever talk to them.
* That comes from immersion, curiosity, and care.


 ⸻
   

  

**The Teammate We're Looking For**
* Thrives at solving complex, technical product problems
* Moves seamlessly between systems thinking and detailed execution
* Excited by the challenge of serving multiple user groups and workflows
* No lone wolves — we need a collaborative engineer
* Big bonus if you have a track record of owning product outcomes, not just tasks


 ⸻
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
* Architecting and building complex workflows across the full stack
* Co-owning the entire product experience from backend to frontend
* Driving product direction through technical execution and intuition
* Becoming an Oracle with a best-in-class customer model in your head


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Hard Skillset**
* Deep experience across backend and frontend systems
* Fluency in TypeScript, Python, or similar modern stacks
* Comfortable with infra, APIs, databases, and debugging messy edge cases
* Bonus if you’ve used AI tools to accelerate development
* Even bigger bonus if you’ve worked in regulated or high-trust domains


 ⸻
   

  

**Your Soft Skillset**
* Comfortable being uncomfortable and making calls with incomplete data
* Empathetic and curious — building for the user, not just for elegance
* Highly collaborative across product, design, and customer support
* Detail-oriented but pragmatic — you know when polish matters and when to move
* You own your work and welcome the accountability that comes with it


 ⸻
   

  

**Growth And Levels**
 We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
   

  

 We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
   

  

 This isn’t a comfy engineering role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.
   

  

 You will build fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**The Process**
* Quick intro call (30 minutes)
* Code walkthrough and async task (60 minutes)
* Final round with our team (120 minutes)


 In just 3.5 hours, you’ll be wanting early access, just like the rest of our team—to dive into the codebase and help build a generational company, even before you start as you'll be able to see the opportunity to transform your career.
   

  

 Compensation Range: $98.4K - $171.5K

title: Frontend Engineer – Growth Web
description:
**Join Aira's mission to transform Europe's energy future**
 Are you passionate about building exceptional web experiences that drive growth and build iconic brands? Join Aira, a pioneering Swedish tech company, and help us craft our digital front door with cutting-edge frontend technology!
   

  

 Aira is at the forefront of clean energy technology. 10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**We are now looking for a talented Frontend Engineer to join our team in Stockholm, focusing on our public website and lead generation platform.**
 This is a unique opportunity to take technical ownership of our most visible platform, ensuring it not only converts visitors into leads but also consistently elevates our brand perception through high-performance, scalable web solutions.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
* Engineer high-impact web applications using React and Next.js — not just shipping features, but shaping how our lead generation platform drives measurable business results. You’ll own both the discovery and technical implementation, ensuring our public website scales with business needs.
* Turn business goals into technical architecture. You’ll work closely with product, marketing, and data teams to translate requirements into scalable systems that optimize for conversions, performance, and future growth.
* Optimize for performance and discoverability. From Core Web Vitals to SEO strategy and A/B testing infrastructure, you’ll design solutions that allow the company to make informed, data-driven decisions.
* Architect and integrate headless CMS workflows that empower non-technical teams while maintaining engineering quality, performance, and scalability.
* Own reliability at scale. You’ll deploy and maintain production applications on Vercel, establish CI/CD pipelines, monitor key metrics, and ensure near-perfect uptime for a mission-critical lead generation platform.
* Shape the product as much as the code. Beyond development, you’ll participate in discovery and decision-making — influencing how we reach 5 million homes by 2034.


**What You'll Bring To The Role**
* React & Next.js expertise — 3+ years building production-grade applications using modern patterns (SSR, SSG, ISR, API routes)
* Systems thinking — ability to design, scale, and evolve architecture in line with fast-moving business needs
* Vercel deployment experience — hands-on knowledge of edge functions, performance tools, and CI/CD best practices
* Headless CMS integration — proven track record with Contentful, Sanity, Strapi, or similar
* SEO mastery — deep knowledge of technical SEO and Core Web Vitals optimization
* A/B testing & CRO — ability to set up experimentation frameworks and act on behavioral data
* Data-driven development — comfort working with analytics and using insights to shape technical decisions


**Essential Skills:**
* TypeScript proficiency
* Advanced CSS skills (Tailwind CSS preferred)
* API integration and data fetching optimization
* Multi-language/international site development
* Performance monitoring and debugging
* Multi-language/international website development


**Professional Requirements:**
* 4 days per week in our Stockholm office
* Strong English communication skills
* Experience working in fast-paced, growth-focused environments


**Please note**
 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
   

  

 Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!
   

  

**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth
* Work with cutting-edge frontend technologies and modern development practices
* Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Data Engineer – AbInitio
description:
