title: Customer Relations Specialist
description:
Gillar du att skapa bra kundupplevelser och bygga relationer? Tre söker nu en Customer Relations Specialist till teamet Large Account Service. Detta är ett längre vikariat på 3 år, då en teammedlem är tjänstledig för studier. Du får ansvar för rollen under perioden och har möjlighet att utveckla och påverka arbetet med våra största företagskunder.
  
  

Om rollen
  
  

Som Customer Relations Specialist blir du en viktig del av ett team som jobbar för att våra kunder ska få bästa möjliga service. Du får flera kollegor och en dedikerad Team Manager som stöd i vardagen. I rollen ansvarar du för ett antal större företagskunder, samtidigt som du hjälper resten av teamets storkunder med deras dagliga ärenden.
  
  

I praktiken innebär det att du ser till att vi levererar service enligt avtal, utvecklar rutiner, föreslår förbättringar och håller kontakt med kunder via mail, telefon och personliga möten. Du koordinerar och rapporterar eventuella problem och ser till att allt flyter smidigt.
  
  

Du kan se fram emot att
  
  

få introduktion, utveckling och kontinuerligt lärande på Tre
  
förvalta stora företagskunder och utveckla ditt administrativa arbetssätt
  
vara en del av att leverera kritisk infrastruktur och bidra direkt till samhällsnyttan
  
vara en del av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt Great Place To Work samt att vi är stolt samarbetspartner till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar
  
Några av våra medarbetare
  
Julia Maxén
  
Gruppchef
  
"Jag vill att mitt team ska få de bästa förutsättningarna för att göra sitt jobb på bästa sätt. Det är så vi utvecklar oss som team, men även utvecklar Tre framåt."
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital projektledare
  
"Det absolut bästa med att vara projektledare på Tre är jag får jobba brett med kollegor från alla delar av organisationen och få lära mig nya saker varje dag. Jag har friheten att vara mig själv – och bli uppskattad för det!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Utvecklare
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

Vem är du?
  
  

Vi tror att du är nyfiken och lösningsfokuserad, och att du tycker om att ge kunder en riktigt bra upplevelse. Kanske har du tidigare erfarenhet av administration eller kundservice, och du känner dig trygg med att planera och genomföra uppgifter på ett strukturerat sätt. Du gillar att bygga relationer, samarbeta med kollegor och skapa förtroende hos både kunder och teamet.
  
  

För att trivas i rollen behöver du kunna kommunicera obehindrat på både svenska och engelska. Du har grundläggande kunskaper i Excel och en god teknisk förståelse, vilket hjälper dig att hantera kundernas frågor på ett effektivt sätt. Du känner dig också trygg med att följa upp kundärenden och bidra till förbättringar i processer och rutiner.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Vi tar emot ansökningar via denna annons och kommer hålla intervjuer löpande. Personligt brev behövs inte, men vi vill gärna att du bifogar CV och svarar på de frågor vi ställt nedan i samband med att du söker. title: Delivery Coordinator
description:
Vill du vara med och ge nya kunder hos Tre en riktigt bra start? Vi söker nu en Delivery Coordinator till Teamet Leverans inom Business Delivery. Detta är ett vikariat på ett och ett halvt år, där du får ansvara för implementering av kunders växellösningar och se till att varje onboarding blir smidig och personlig.
  
  

Om rollen
  
  

I Leverans arbetar du med egna kundprojekt och ser till att varje kund får en anpassad och lyckad start. Du planerar och ansvarar för projekten utifrån både våra resurser och kundens behov, tillsammans med interna säljare och externa partners. Primärt fokuserar du på vår egen 3Växel samt olika partner-MEX.
  
  

Ditt arbete innebär personlig kommunikation, problemlösning och att säkerställa att allt flyter smidigt – från projektstart till det att kunden är igång och nöjd. Du förstår att varje kund är unik och anpassar arbetet efter deras behov, vilket gör att du skapar riktigt bra kundupplevelser. Våra introduktionsveckor ger dig en stabil grund för att snabbt komma in i rollen och lyckas.

få introduktion, utveckling och kontinuerligt lärande på Tre

title: System Architect Laundry
description:
At Electrolux Professional Group we hire to meet needs beyond tomorrow  



**UNLOCK YOUR POTENTIAL**

At **Electrolux Professional Group** , we believe potential powers progress. We’re not searching for perfection – we’re looking for


people with the right mindset. If you’re curious, resilient and ready to grow, you’ll find the space to lead, innovate and together with us, **Meet the Needs Beyond Tomorrow** .


https://www.electroluxprofessionalgroup.com/en/join-us/  



**System Architect & Team Lead – Laundry**

We are seeking a highly experienced and strategic **System Architect & R&D Team Lead** to drive the development of integrated system architectures for our professional laundry solutions while also leading cross-functional team of engineers and specialists. This dual-role position combines deep technical expertise with strong leadership capabilities, playing a key part in shaping our product platforms and guiding the team toward successful execution.


You will be responsible for defining and maintaining the system architecture across mechanical, electrical, software, and digital domains, while also guiding a team of R&D professionals. Your leadership will ensure technical excellence, innovation, and alignment with business goals in a fast-paced, customer-focused environment.


  
**WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING**

**System Architecture & Technical Leadership**

* Define and maintain scalable, modular system architecture for professional laundry equipment, ensuring long-term performance and maintainability.
* Lead system-level design activities, including specifications, interface definitions, technical reviews, and validation.

**Team Management & Leadership**

* Guide a cross-functional R&D team, setting clear goals and ensuring timely delivery of milestones.
* Foster a culture of collaboration, technical excellence, and continuous improvement.

**Strategic Collaboration**

* Align architecture and development with product roadmaps through close collaboration with Product Management, Project Leaders, and Manufacturing Engineering.
* Partner with sourcing and supplier teams to evaluate and integrate external technologies.

**Innovation & Technology Strategy**

* Drive integration of emerging technologies (e.g., IoT, predictive maintenance, automation) into future platforms.
* Promote platformization and reuse strategies to enhance efficiency and reduce complexity.

**Documentation & Standards**

* Ensure comprehensive system documentation and traceability across architecture and interfaces.
* Champion compliance with industry standards and best practices in systems engineering and lifecycle management.

  
**WHAT’S NEEDED FOR YOU TO THRIVE**

* Master’s degree in Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field, with a minimum of 10+ years of experience in system architecture or complex product development, including at least 3 years in a leadership role.
* Proven experience in developing professional appliances, industrial automation, or commercial equipment.
* Deep understanding of embedded systems, industrial connectivity protocols (e.g., Modbus, OPC UA), and cloud integration, along with knowledge of sustainability principles, energy efficiency standards, and lifecycle cost optimization.
* Hands-on experience with model-based systems engineering (MBSE) using tools like SysML, UML, and Enterprise Architect, as well as familiarity with simulation tools, system modeling, and performance analysis.
* Strong leadership capabilities in people management and team development, with excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, and the ability to inspire and align cross-functional teams toward common goals.
Preferred qualifications include experience in the professional laundry or industrial appliance sector, knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies and digital product development, and familiarity with PLM systems, requirements management, and version control systems.  
* 

**OUR CULTURE IN 4 WORDS**

Be Customer Obsessed. Build Trust. Be Bold. Act Sustainably.


(We’re building it every day — and we’d love your help.)  



**WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU**

* Trust, ownership and the opportunity to grow.
* Be part of a company grounded in customer focus, sustainable leadership, innovation and social impact. We aim to Meet Need Beyond Tomorrow.
* The possibility to work hybrid and build a flexible work-life balance.
* Be part of an industry shift that makes a difference – in how people live, cook, clean, care and serve.
* Plus: country-specific perks and benefits designed to support your well-being.

  
**Electrolux Professional Group - meeting needs beyond tomorrow**

Electrolux Professional Group is the sustainability leader in our industry and one of the leading global providers of food service, beverage, and laundry equipment for professional users. Our innovative products and worldwide service network make our customers’ work-life easier, more profitable – and truly sustainable every day. Our solutions and products are sold in over 110 countries. In 2024, the Electrolux Professional Group had global sales of SEK 12.5bn and approximately 4,300 employees. Electrolux Professional’s B-shares are listed at Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit https://www.electroluxprofessionalgroup.com

title: Digital kreatör
description:
Nöjeskvarteret Malmborgen AB i centrala Malmö har som ambition att tillgodose en helhetsupplevelse avseende nöjen till våra gäster genom våra olika inriktningar. Hos oss hittar man allt från pub, restauranger, nattklubbar, vinkällare, festvåningar, gatukök samt vår fina uteservering Gränden på sommaren.
  
Vi strävar hela tiden efter att ge våra gäster det lilla extra vad gäller miljö, service samt gastronomisk upplevelse.
  
Till Nöjeskvarteret Malmborgen söker vi nu ambitiös och engagerade Digital kreatör med start inom en snar framtid.
  
Arbetet omfattar primärt att ansvara för vår social media såsom Google my Business, Facebook och Instagram. Du kommer även att aktivt arbeta med att marknadsföra vårt fest- och konferenserbjudande. En viktig del är att skapa fina nyhetsbrev i tex Minute mailer samt trycksaker via Adobe Photoshop.
  
Vi ser gärna att du har en god erfarenhet utav sociala media och att du behärskar fotografering i vanlig miljö samt i nattklubbsmiljö. Du bör även kunna producera videounderlag i exempelvis Adobe Premier PRO.
  
Du behärskar Canva, Adobe Creative Cloud och speciellt photoshop och Premier Pro. Du är även en van användare av hemsida i Wordpress samt SEO i samband med Wordpress och Google.
  
Som person är du glad, ambitiös, stresstålig och pålitlig. Du brinner för att ge våra gäster den absolut bästa service. Vidare är du en lagspelare som trivs i en dynamisk miljö. För våra gästers skull ser vi gärna att du är snus- och rökfri.
  
För rätt person finns fina utvecklingsmöjligheter inom vårt företag som kan leda till en mer senior roll.
  
Tjänster är för deltid ca 10-20 timmar per vecka och kan vara ett bra komplement till studier eller annat arbete.
  
Lön enligt kollektivavtal. Vänligen skicka ditt CV och gärna en bild på dig.
  
Vänligen märk er ansökan ”Digital kreatör NKM 2025”
  
Ansökningar tages emot löpande och anställning påbörjas inom en relativ snar framtid.
  
**För mer info, kontakta:** markus.walterstrom@malmborgen.nu
  
Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Databasexpert till Knowit Core
description:
Har du en bakgrund som DBA och vill fortsätta utvecklas inom moln och moderna arkitekturer? På Knowit Core i Malmö söker vi nu dig som vill kombinera din erfarenhet av klassiska databaser med nya arbetssätt inom cloud och medaljong arkitektur.
  
Om rollen
  
Hos oss får du möjlighet att bygga vidare på din expertis inom Oracle eller Microsoft SQL Server och samtidigt utveckla dig inom moderna data- och molnplattformar. Vi letar efter dig som har en solid grund i PL/SQL eller T-SQL men som de senaste åren även arbetat med cloud-miljöer och moderna dataplattformar.
  
**Du kommer att arbeta i projekt där du får:** • Designa och förvalta databasmiljöer i både klassiska och molnbaserade lösningar • Bygga och optimera pipelines och datamodeller enligt medaljong arkitektur. • Jobba nära kollegor inom Data Engineering, Cloud och BI för att skapa kompletta lösningar • Utforska nya tekniker och metoder som driver utvecklingen framåt
  
Vem är du?
  
Vi tror att du • Har flera års erfarenhet som DBA inom Oracle eller Microsoft SQL Server • Är trygg i PL/SQL eller T-SQL • Har minst två års erfarenhet av moderna datastackar och molnplattformar • Har kunskap eller intresse för medallion architecture och cloud services • Talar och skriver svenska obehindrat, engelska är också en naturlig del av din vardag
  
Tidigare konsultbakgrund är meriterande, men inget krav. Viktigast är att du är nyfiken och vill fortsätta växa i rollen.
  
Vad vi erbjuder
  
Hos oss på Knowit Core Malmö blir du en del av ett öppet och välkomnande team där vi utvecklas tillsammans. Vi erbjuder en trygg anställning, starka förmåner och ett kontor mitt på Stortorget med fantastisk utsikt över staden.
  
Vi är stolta över att vara en arbetsplats som satsar på kompetensutveckling och hållbarhet, och vi ser till att du får rätt förutsättningar för att ta nästa steg i din karriär.
  
Vill du bygga framtidens dataplattformar med oss? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag.

title: Senior Hardware Design Engineer
description:
Senior Hardware Design Engineer


Swedium Global Services is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Job Name: Senior Hardware Developer


Location: Onsite in Sweden


We are now looking for a hardware developer with focus on PCB design. You will work in close collaboration with digital-, mechanical-, thermal design, and production to develop high quality PCB´s.  

  

Your role will include all development activities such as: Requirement analysis, Product Lifecycle Management support and Technical Documentation of PCB´s. You will join a team focusing on PCB design using the tool Cadence Allegro and collaborate with multi-functional development teams in which continuous improvement, innovation and knowledge sharing is part of the daily work.  



You will  

* Design PCB using design tools from Cadence.
* Develop and analyze board floor plans
* Drive improvements in ways of working with PCB/PBA design
* Share knowledge with colleagues
* Work in projects in the PCB area

Requirements  

* +3 years of relevant experience of PCB design
* Understanding of PCB manufacturing processes
* Knowledge from Cadence Allegro (or similar PCB design tools)
* Problem solving mentality anf good analytical skills
* Understanding of tele-communications and electrical design
* Understanding of mass production and statistics in design
* Understanding of thermal design
* Understanding of simulation tools for radio, signal and power integrity and thermal design
* Scripting in skills
* Excellent English in speech, reading and writing

  
Job Overview


* Location : Gothenburg, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : Allegro, PCB,

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
Join our growing Security Engineering team as a DevSecOps Engineer, where you'll take ownership of security tooling, automation, and infrastructure hardening, not just for the Stillfront Group, but also helping our 20+ game studios across the world.


In this role, you won’t just shift left - you’ll sit at the heart of security operations, helping to design, implement, and manage the systems that protect our platforms at scale.

**YOUR MISSION**

* Own and Operate Security Tooling: Deploy, configure, and maintain security tools and platforms (e.g. vulnerability scanners, email protection, endpoint protection, SSO, SAST/DAST tools, secrets managers, container security platforms)
* Automate Security Operations: Build automation around security workflows, alert triage, and tool integrations using Python, Bash, Terraform, or similar tools
* Vulnerability Management: Manage vulnerability detection tools, run or facilitate penetration tests, test impact from real exploits, support remediation workflows, and help teams prioritize risks based on real-world impact
* Secure the Infrastructure: Collaborate with platform and cloud engineering teams to ensure secure configurations across AWS/GCP/Azure environments, including networking, IAM, logging, and encryption
* Monitoring and Threat Detection: Support detection engineering efforts by ensuring telemetry from cloud services, containers, and endpoints flows reliably into monitoring platforms
* Access & Secrets Management: Help design and maintain secure identity and access practices, including secrets management solutions

  

**YOUR BACKSTORY**

* 2–4+ years of experience in a security engineering, DevSecOps, or infrastructure security role, ideally within cloud-native environments
* Strong knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP), including security services (IAM, KMS, VPC security, CloudTrail, etc.) and best practices for securing workloads
* Hands-on experience managing security tools Strong scripting and automation skills in Python, Bash, or Go to build integrations, automate tasks, and customize tooling
* Understanding of core security principles, including least privilege, zero trust, defense in depth, and threat modeling
* Great communication and collaboration skills — you’ll work closely with local engineers as well as game developers at the studios.
* Relevant Certifications such as AWS Certified Security – Specialty, GIAC (e.g., GSEC, GCSA), or more general security certification such as Security+, OSCP or CISSP, etc.
* Contributions to open-source security projects or active participation in the security community (e.g., blog posts, talks, GitHub contributions)
* Experience in threat detection or detection engineering, including writing custom detection rules or working with MITRE ATT&CK framework
* Ability to assess and prioritize risk, translate technical issues into business impact, and make pragmatic security decisions.

##### **Stillfront**


Stillfront is a global gaming company. We develop a wide range of digital games that attract over 50 million players each month. From well-established franchises like Supremacy, Big Farm, and BitLife to niche games, we span many different genres, including strategy, simulation, RPG and action, and casual and mash-up games.


We believe gaming can be a force for good. And we want to create a gaming universe that is digital, affordable, equal, and sustainable. So, we focus on developing games that are all about having a rewarding hobby, a great social experience, or a strategic challenge.


Our HQ is in Stockholm, Sweden, but our game development is done by teams and studios all over the world. Our main markets are the US, Japan, MENA, Germany, and the UK. We’re proud that our company shares are listed on the Nasdaq Stockholm.

title: Data Architect
description:
About Chapter Two
Powering the World's Music Rights Transactions.


Chapter Two is building the future of music rights investments by creating an open standard for valuations, transactions, and royalty data—offering access to some of the world’s most exclusive music catalogs.


Their platform enables music catalog transactions at scale, powered by analytics and extensive data.


About the Role
Now they're looking for a Data Architect who can define and build the foundation of their data infrastructure. This role is critical to scaling their product, ensuring their systems remain reliable, secure, and efficient as they grow.


You’ll be both strategic and hands-on—designing data systems while actively coding and implementing solutions. Working closely with the rest of the team at Chapter Two, you’ll provide the seniority and direction needed to make the right architectural decisions for their data platform.

#### **What You’ll Do**

* Shape Data Architecture – Design scalable, secure, and adaptable data systems for royalty data and music rights transactions.
* Build and Automate Pipelines – Create dependable ETL pipelines that ingest, transform, and enrich data, leveraging AWS services and Infrastructure as Code.
* Database Optimization & Modeling – Use your strong PostgreSQL skills to design efficient schemas, optimize queries, and ensure high-performance data access.
* Governance & Data Quality – Establish standards and policies that ensure accuracy, security, and trust in our royalty and valuation data.
* Evaluate & Advise – Assess architectural trade-offs, explain them clearly, and guide stakeholders toward the best balance of scalability, performance, cost, and complexity.

#### **Their current Stack**


Development in Python, Typescript, and cloud hosted in AWS (Step Functions, SageMaker, PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, and IaC).


About you
We believe that you are an experienced Data Engineer or Data Architect with deep knowledge of cloud-based, scalable architectures. You have experience and have been part of scaling a Data Platform.

* Hands-on experience with ETL/ELT pipelines, orchestration, and automation
* Comfortable working with AWS services and Infrastructure as Code (CloudFormation/Terraform)
* Able to balance strategic architecture decisions with practical implementation
* Familiar with best practices from companies handling large-scale data
* Skilled in Python
* Curious, energetic, and proactive—just as eager to experiment and learn as you are to bring proven solutions

#### **Why join Chapter Two?**


At Chapter Two, they cultivate a highly goal-oriented work environment. They value driven, self-motivated individuals who are passionate about achieving results. If you thrive in a setting where you can take ownership, be creative, and make a tangible impact, you’ll fit right in. This is a chance for you to have an impact in a technical landscape with no legacy.


They offer a chance to grow with their business and become a key player in their journey. While they operate on a global scale, their main office is located in the vibrant Slussen area. They have a hybrid setup, but it’s encouraged to meet with the team at the office as often as possible. Along with a competitive salary, they provide a generous stock option package to ensure your contributions are recognized and rewarded.

title: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)
description:
Stillfront Group is on a mission to protect its global digital ecosystem and ensure the security of our portfolio of gaming experiences. We are seeking an experienced and hands-on Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to lead our cybersecurity efforts. The CISO will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our cybersecurity strategy, driving risk management, and ensuring the highest level of information security across all studios and operations. This position reports directly to the CIO and will be based in our Stockholm headquarters, with the flexibility to collaborate globally with our diverse and dynamic teams.

**YOUR MISSION**

* Developing and executing a comprehensive information security strategy that aligns with Stillfront's business objectives and risk appetite
* Overseeing the implementation of security measures, ensuring protection across our infrastructure, platforms, and game development studios
* Leading a global security team in the identification, assessment, and mitigation of cybersecurity risks, including security architecture, governance, and incident response
* Monitoring and ensuring compliance with cybersecurity regulations and standards across our global operations
* Collaborating with internal stakeholders, including IT, Legal, and Product Development teams, to integrate security into every phase of product, game and service development
* Managing relationships with external security vendors, consultants, and partners to ensure the most up-to-date security solutions are in place
* Providing executive leadership with regular reporting on the status of cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and remediation efforts
* Leading incident response efforts, including investigation, reporting, and remediation of security incidents, breaches, and threats
* Championing a culture of security awareness across the organization through training and best practices

**YOUR BACKSTORY**

  

* A minimum of 10 years of experience in information security, risk management, or a related field, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role
* Proven experience in developing and implementing security strategies, frameworks, and policies for global organizations
* A deep understanding of cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, and countermeasures, with expertise in incident response and crisis management
* Strong knowledge of information security standards such as ISO 27001, NIST, and GDPR compliance
* Hands-on experience with security technologies, including WAF, intrusion detection systems, endpoint protection, encryption, and cloud security
* Experience working with regulatory bodies and compliance requirements in a global context
* Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with senior stakeholders and cross-functional teams
* A proactive, strategic thinker, with the ability to operate in a fast-paced, ever-evolving environment. Relevant certifications, such as CISSP, CISM, or CISA, are desirable
* Fluent in English, with Swedish as a plus

##### **Stillfront**


Stillfront is a global gaming company. We develop a wide range of digital games that attract over 50 million players each month. From well-established franchises like Supremacy, Big Farm, and BitLife to niche games, we span many different genres, including strategy, simulation, RPG and action, and casual and mash-up games.


We believe gaming can be a force for good. And we want to create a gaming universe that is digital, affordable, equal, and sustainable. So, we focus on developing games that are all about having a rewarding hobby, a great social experience, or a strategic challenge.


Our HQ is in Stockholm, Sweden, but our game development is done by teams and studios all over the world. Our main markets are the US, Japan, MENA, Germany, and the UK. We’re proud that our company shares are listed on the Nasdaq Stockholm.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
*The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a* ***Senior Full Stack Engineer*** *to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.*

***Period:*** *ASAP to 2025-12-31 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.*

#### **About the role**


The team works on the development and implementation of genre taxonomies in a multilingual, multicultural environment. They help ensure that the client's content is properly organized and discoverable for people in different markets with different expectations.  

  

We are currently seeking a Senior Fullstack Engineer with focus on backend engineering to help the team develop and expand their genre taxonomy systems. We are looking for someone who understands modern cloud computing and network architecture, and knows how to map technology solutions to business requirements.

#### **What you'll do**

* Responsibilities include solution design and end-to-end implementation of capabilities within an existing set of services and data pipelines. As an engineer in this area you will have the opportunity to implement changes and improvement to complex systems

#### **Who you are**

* You are a skilled backend engineer with experience building and scaling services in Java
* You have experience working with data pipelines and mapping services
* You are comfortable working across the stack and have experience with frontend app develop using React and Next.j
* You have excellent problem-solving and fast decision-making skills with a strong bias for action
* You have strong writing and communication skills, and are comfortable driving engineering deep dives and workshops, as well as stakeholder demos
* You are self-driven and can work both independently and as part of a team
* Experience working with taxonomies is a plus

#### **We are Market Partner**

*Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like.* *We apply ongoing selection and may fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.*

title: Databricks Specialist
description:
Do you want to work with one of the most exciting data platforms on the market and take your expertise to the next level? At Knowit Core in Malmö, we are looking for Data Engineers who are passionate about building scalable data solutions with Databricks at the center of it all.

**Why Knowit Core?**


At Knowit Core you get the best of both worlds, the agility of a fast-moving company and the stability of a well-established consultancy. We collaborate across teams, share knowledge daily, and drive innovation together. With 120 colleagues in Malmö, you will be part of a strong community working across Cloud, Data, and AI.


We are proud to be a selected Databricks partner, giving you the opportunity to work closely with the platform and stay ahead with the latest features, best practices, and joint initiatives.

**About the role**


As a Data Engineer focusing on Databricks, you will help our clients design, build, and orchestrate modern data platforms in whichever cloud they prefer (Azure, AWS, or GCP). You will get to explore new features and capabilities like Databricks Genie, dive into UC metrics and experiment with the possibilities of Databricks One.


Your daily work may include  

* Building and orchestrating data pipelines with PySpark
* Managing data governance through Unity Catalog
* Working with AI and BI integrations to unlock business value
* Helping clients establish scalable and secure Lakehouse architectures
**Who are you?**


We believe you have a strong foundation as a Data Engineer, with at least a few years of hands-on experience. You are curious, eager to learn, and want to deepen your skills within Databricks and its ecosystem.


We expect you to bring  

* Proven experience with Databricks
* Strong skills in PySpark
* Experience with data orchestration and management in Unity Catalog
  

If you have previously worked in consulting, that is a plus. An interest or experience in AI or ML will make you stand out even more.

**What we offer**


At Knowit Core Malmö you will join a team that values collaboration, curiosity, and fun. We offer  

* Cutting-edge projects across industries like retail, finance, automotive, and industry
* The freedom to work with any major cloud provider
* Continuous competence development through certifications, trainings, and conferences
* A modern workplace in central Malmö, complete with a rooftop terrace

We believe that the future of data engineering is Databricks-driven. Do you want to be part of shaping it?

**Location and work setup**


For this position, you need to be based in Sweden and available to work on-site at our Malmö office several days a week. Please note that we are not able to provide relocation assistance.


We believe that the future of data engineering is Databricks-driven. Do you want to be part of shaping it?


Apply today and join us on the journey.

title: AWS - ISV Partner Account Manager - Public Sector - Europe North
description:
**DESCRIPTION**
---------------


Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry?
  

Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for pioneering candidates to help develop and manage our partnerships with leading independent software vendors (ISV) within the Europe North market (BeNeLux, Nordics, Baltics).  

  

As an ISV Partner Account Manager within the AWS Public Sector team, you will join a friendly and supportive team and have the exciting opportunity to help execute on our strategy to build mind share and drive adoption of AWS services across AWS’s most strategic business partners and their customers.  

  

AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud.
  

  

Join us and help us grow.  

  

Key job responsibilities  

Your responsibilities will include driving executive and field relationships with leading ISVs, practically impacting Public Sector AWS adoption. By establishing and growing business and technical relationships, and managing the day-to-day interactions with these partners, you will help to drive overall end customer adoption with the Public Sector segments.  

  

The ideal candidate will possess both a business background that enables them to engage at the CxO level, as well as a customer facing background that enables them to easily interact with public sector customers and AWS team members.
  

  

They should also have a demonstrable ability to think big about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to convey compelling value propositions which help partners deliver sustainable business value and assist customers in accomplishing their mission.  

  

Come build the future with us.

**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------------

* Experience in the North European Information Technology industry with ability to influence C-level decision makers as well as field based resources.
* Track record of success building trusted relationships with customers / partners
* Strong Sales / Resuls orientation
* Verbal and written communications skills and ability to articulate complex concepts
* Ability to work effectively across large and sometimes complex internal and external organizations
* Operating skills (forecasting, pipeline management, account planning, business cadence)
* Fluent Swedish and English
* Technical acumen, with a demonstrated track record of driving emerging/disruptive technologies, virtualization, Software as a Service delivery models and AWS Marketplace

**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS**
----------------------------

* Master's degree in a technical discipline and/or MBA or equivalent
* Good understanding of the Europe North public sector and partner landscape.
